0.title: Filled with passion, love & sincerity: Vijay Deverakonda on 'Major'
0.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Vijay Deverakonda praised Adivi Sesh's film 'Major'. "A film filled with passion, love and sincerity...Definitely watch this one to know about our hero," Vijay tweeted. "Congratulations to the entire team! And my warmest respect and love to the parents of Major Sandeep [Unnikrishnan]," he added. The film also featured Saiee Manjrekar and Sobhita Dhulipala.

1.title: Shooter Avani Lekhara wins gold with world record in Para World Cup
1.article_body: Tokyo Paralympics gold medallist Avani Lekhara won gold at the Para Shooting World Cup with a world record score of 250.6 in women’s 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1 in Chateauroux, France on Tuesday. The 20-year-old shooter broke her own world record of 249.6 to secure her a spot at the 2024 Paris Paralympics.

2.title: Accused used govt vehicle in Hyd's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case: Police
2.article_body: The accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case used a government vehicle to commit crime, Hyderabad City Commissioner of Police CV Anand said. "The vehicle was allotted to one of the accused's father, who is a government employee. Two vehicles were used...and were driven by minors," he added. A 17-year-old girl was gang-raped in Jubilee Hills area on May 28.

3.title: Credit cards can now be linked to UPI, starting with RuPay: RBI
3.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday announced that credit cards will now be allowed to be linked with the UPI accounts. The implementation will begin with the indigenous RuPay credit cards, followed by other card networks such as Visa and Mastercard. Until now, customers could only link their debit cards to UPI.

4.title: Kamal Haasan gifts Lexus car to 'Vikram' director, Apache bikes to 13 assistant directors
4.article_body: Following the success of 'Vikram', actor Kamal Haasan gifted a Lexus car to the film's director Lokesh Kanagaraj. He also gifted Apache RTR 160 bikes to 13 assistant directors who worked on the film. The film has crossed ₹200-crore earnings worldwide in the first five days of its release. 'Vikram' is Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide.

5.title: World Bank approves $1.49 billion in further aid to Ukraine
5.article_body: The World Bank's executive board has approved an additional fund of $1.49 billion for Ukraine amid its ongoing war with Russia. With this, the total monetary assistance it pledged to aid Ukraine crossed to over $4 billion. The latest funding was backed by countries including Britain, the Netherlands, Lithuania, Latvia and Italy.

6.title: Russia losing 300 soldiers a day: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
6.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed that over 31,000 Russian soldiers have lost their lives in Ukraine since the invasion began. "Since February 24, Russia has been paying almost 300 lives a day for a completely pointless war," Zelenskyy said. "And still the day will come when the number of losses, even for Russia, will exceed the permissible limit," he added.

7.title: He's Hercules, even surprises his own team: Aus Open director on Nadal
7.article_body: Australian Open director Craig Tiley said Rafael Nadal is "Hercules", adding that he even surprises his own team. "[His team is] just as surprised as the rest of us are because never did Rafa himself think that [he will win the French Open]," stated Tiley. "To...win it as convincingly as he did in the [final] is honestly remarkable," said Tiley.

8.title: Suspected cattle carcasses found in Noida dump yard; police begin probe
8.article_body: Police have launched an investigation after suspected cattle carcasses were found in a dump yard in Noida. A passerby informed the police about the carcasses at around 12:30 am on Tuesday, police said, adding that it might have been thrown on Monday night. "Four police teams have been formed to investigate...case," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Central Noida) Harish Chander.

9.title: Rahul Tripathi was the best no. 3 batter of IPL 2022: Sehwag
9.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, terming him the "best number three batter" of IPL 2022. "If you look at all teams, if there's one player who attained most success at number three, it's Rahul Tripathi...he contributed a lot to SRH winning five matches in a row," stated Sehwag. Tripathi scored 413 runs in IPL 2022.

10.title: 17 people killed, 50 injured as train derails in Iran
10.article_body: At least 17 people have been killed and 50 others have been injured after a train derailed in Iran on Wednesday, state TV reported. Of those wounded, over 12 have sustained severe injuries, officials said. The passenger train derailed on the Tabas-Yazd line in eastern Iran. According to reports, the accident took place after the train collided with an excavator.

11.title: Problematic in hierarchal organisations: Cong leader on CDS selection pool widening
11.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari said widening the pool for selection of CDS is not necessarily a bad idea but in "strictly regimented" and "hierarchal organisations" it may be problematic to put a retired officer over serving chiefs. The Centre issued three separate notifications amending the rules of the Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next CDS.

12.title: Cancer vanishes in all 12 patients for the '1st time in history' during drug trial in US
12.article_body: Cancer vanished in all 12 patients who participated in a drug trial in US, with a doctor saying, "I believe this is the first time this has happened in history of cancer." The rectal cancer patients were given dostarlimab every three weeks for six months. Results of the trial have been published in The New England Journal of Medicine.

13.title: He fired 17 or 19 shots: Spurs' Emerson on being robbed at gunpoint
13.article_body: Sharing his experience of being robbed at gunpoint, Tottenham Hotspur defender Emerson Royal said, "When I give him what he wants...he unlocks his gun to shoot me...He starts shooting everywhere and doesn't hit anyone." "He fired 17 or 19 shots," added Emerson. "I understood that it was a moment that could cost me my life," stated Emerson.

14.title: Muslims need to give up 'kafir', 'ummah' & 'jihad': RSS leader
14.article_body: Muslims need to give up three concepts - 'kafir' (non-believer), 'ummah' (a supra-national community tied by religion) and 'jihad' (struggle, sometimes used for 'holy war'), said RSS leader Ram Madhav. He added that once Indian Muslims "accept" that their roots predate Islamic invasions, Hindus will stop talking about the "destruction that happened hundreds of years ago".

15.title: Launching Moto g82 5G's revolutionary Billion Colour Display: Motorola
15.article_body: Motorola India announced that it has disrupted the sub-20K smartphone market by launching Moto g82 5G with 10-bit billion colour display, starting at ₹19,999*. The phone's pOLED display supports 120Hz refresh rate for the most fluid experience, the brand stated. Moto g82 5G will go on sale on Flipkart, Reliance Digital and leading retail stores starting 14th June 2022.

16.title: I think Root is going to get very close to Sachin's Test tally: Watson
16.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said England's Joe Root is going to get "very close" to Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket. "Root has got a lot of great cricket in front of him," he added. Tendulkar ended his career with 15,921 runs in 200 Tests while Root currently has 10,015 runs in 118 Tests.

17.title: Have been working hard on my T20 game: Hazlewood on 4-wicket haul vs SL
17.article_body: Talking about his four-wicket haul against Sri Lanka in their first T20I, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said he has been focusing on the shortest format of the game. "The wicket was slow...the new ball flew off the bat a little bit, and we dragged [the length back]," he added. Australia won the match by 10 wickets.

18.title: Coach asked me to sleep with him, said I should behave like his wife: Indian woman cyclist
18.article_body: A top Indian woman cyclist, in her complaint to Sports Authority of India, said the national team's chief coach RK Sharma allegedly forced her into his room in Slovenia and asked her to sleep with him. "He made comments like...I should behave like his wife as he's extremely fond of me and wants me to be his wife," she added.

19.title: 16-yr-old UP boy shoots mother dead for stopping him from playing PUBG
19.article_body: A 16-year-old boy allegedly shot his mother dead after she debarred him from playing PUBG in UP's Lucknow, police said. "A preliminary probe revealed he was addicted to the game...mother used to stop him from playing...he committed the (crime) with his father's pistol," police added. The boy tried to mislead the police by "narrating a fake story about some electrician".

20.title: Such rhetoric will tarnish country’s image: Cong's Adhir on Prophet remarks
20.article_body: Following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said if such "rhetoric" is allowed in India, it will only "tarnish" the country's image. "Strict action should be taken against those responsible for tarnishing the country’s image. Do not try to save them by making excuses," he added.

21.title: Car hits bull on Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Greater Noida, 2 injured
21.article_body: Two men were injured after their car hit a bull on the Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Greater Noida on Monday evening. "The black bull was not visible in...dark and the car crashed into it as the animal was standing in the middle of the expressway," a police officer said. The car was badly damaged in the accident, he added.

22.title: Indian cycling team called back from Slovenia after cyclist accuses coach of misbehaviour
22.article_body: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has called the entire Indian contingent back to India from Slovenia after a female cyclist accused chief coach RK Sharma of "inappropriate behaviour". The Indian endurance contingent, comprising five male and one female cyclists, was scheduled to return on June 14. An inquiry committee has been formed to look into the matter.

23.title: Better.com CEO who fired 900 on Zoom call sued for 'misleading investors'
23.article_body: A former Better.com executive has sued the company and CEO Vishal Garg, alleging they provided misleading statements to ensure investors go through with a SPAC merger instead of withdrawing due to its financial condition. Last year, Garg had to apologise for his manner of handling layoffs after a video of him firing 900 employees over a Zoom call went viral.

24.title: Don't let them dull your shine: Malaika on Arjun's reply to a troll
24.article_body: Malaika Arora, taking to Instagram Stories, reacted to her boyfriend Arjun Kapoor's reply to an Instagram user who said Arjun can "never get in shape". Arjun took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Fitness isn't about a six-pack, fitness is about mental, emotional...physical well being." Reacting to it, Malaika wrote, "Don't ever let these trolls and criticism dull your shine."

25.title: 70 yrs after extinction in India, 1st Cheetah batch to arrive from Africa
25.article_body: After 70 years of their extinction in India, first batch of cheetahs is all set to arrive from South Africa in August. The batch of five-six cheetahs will be translocated to Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh. "All the modalities for bringing cheetahs have been completed and the agreement with South Africa is in place," an official said.

26.title: Fire breaks out at electric motor parking in Delhi, over 90 vehicles gutted
26.article_body: A fire broke out at the electric motor parking in Delhi's Jamia Nagar, Delhi Fire Service officials said. A total of 10 cars, one motorcycle, two scooty, 30 new e-rickshaws and 50 old e-rickshaws caught fire, they added. As many as seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was brought under control, the officials stated.

27.title: Which are the top 10 most expensive locations for overseas workers?
27.article_body: Hong Kong is the most expensive location for overseas workers, followed by New York, Geneva, London and Tokyo, according to ECA International. Tel Aviv has been ranked sixth followed by Zurich, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Seoul. ECA International has been conducting research into cost of living for 50 years.

28.title: Lalu Yadav fined ₹6,000 in 13-yr-old poll code violation case
28.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was fined ₹6,000 in a 13-year-old case related to model code violation by a court in Jharkhand's Palamu. During the 2009 Assembly elections campaign, Yadav's helicopter landed on a paddy field instead of the designated spot in Garhwa town where he was to address a rally. This was found in violation of the poll code.

29.title: Nupur Sharma entitled to her opinions, Hindu Gods insulted every day: Kangana
29.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while talking about BJP leader Nupur Sharma's suspension over her remarks about the Prophet, said that Sharma is entitled to her opinions. "When Hindu Gods are insulted, which they are almost every day, we go to court, please do that. No need to play dons yourself, this is not Afghanistan," she wrote on Instagram.

30.title: I was 18 when I converted to Islam, being a Muslim is not easy: Pogba
30.article_body: Ex-Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba said late boxing legend Muhammad Ali is his inspiration, adding that he converted to Islam just like Ali converted to Islam. "I was 18 and sometimes...[being] a Muslim is not easy," stated Pogba. "He saved a lot of people...just by giving a good message...saying the truth when it was difficult to say," said Pogba.

31.title: Passengers can now carry foldable bicycles in Bengaluru Metro
31.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced that commuters can carry foldable bicycles in the last coach of metro trains during their travel without any luggage charge. The size of the foldable bicycles shouldn't exceed 60 cm x 45 cm x 25 cm in dimension and not exceed 15 kg in weight, BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez said.

32.title: BJP youth wing functionary arrested over tweet on Prophet Muhammad
32.article_body: A BJP youth wing functionary, Harshit Srivastav, who was the former Kanpur Nagar's Yuva Morcha district secretary, was arrested for his alleged inflammatory tweet against Prophet Muhammad. This comes days after clashes erupted in Kanpur over objectionable remarks made by Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from BJP. A total of 50 persons have been arrested in connection with Kanpur violence.

33.title: Judge who ordered video survey of Gyanvapi mosque gets threat, security increased
33.article_body: Civil Judge Ravi Diwakar, who passed orders for the video survey of Gyanvapi mosque, has received a threat letter from the Islamic Agaz Movement. According to the police, a total of nine police personnel have been deployed for his security. Moreover, officials said that the security of the civil judge in Varanasi and his mother in Lucknow is being reviewed.

34.title: Want laws that won't make it easy for bad guys to get guns: McConaughey
34.article_body: While speaking at the White House, Hollywood actor Matthew McConaughey appealed for gun control legislation to be passed in honour of the victims of the Texas school shooting incident. "We want secure and safe schools and we want gun laws that won't make it so easy for the bad guys to get the damn guns," he added.

35.title: Said that because we all are one family: Pakistan's Rizwan on 'Our Virat Kohli' remark
35.article_body: Talking about his 'He's our Virat Kohli' remark, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said, "If I said 'he's our Virat Kohli', it's because we all are a family." "Other players told me 'Virat is aggressive and all'. But the way he met me before and after the match...it was amazing," Rizwan further said about meeting Kohli during T20 World Cup 2021.

36.title: Nothing found at Satyendar Jain's house, BJP lying: AAP on ED's raid
36.article_body: AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said that nothing was found at Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain’s house during the raid conducted by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). "They (BJP) are lying…They spread fake rumours that cash and gold coins were recovered," Bharadwaj added. "The seizure memo of the ED raid was given to the wife and daughter of Satyendar Jain," he stated.

37.title: Odisha launches helpline number for protection of abandoned animals
37.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday launched a state helpline number to provide emergency healthcare services to abandoned and stray animals in the state. The toll-free number '1962 or 155333' will be available round the clock and will extend veterinary service through animal ambulance in 11 urban areas. The CM also launched a tele-veterinary service.

38.title: Iran conducts mass execution of 12 Baluch prisoners: Report
38.article_body: Iran carried out a mass execution of 12 prisoners, all belonging to the minority community of Baluch, said Norway-based Iran Human Rights (IHR) on Tuesday. The 12, including one woman, were hanged on Monday after being convicted on drug-related or murder charges. The woman was sentenced to death for the murder of her husband.

39.title: Proud to be part of their conscious inclusiveness: Farhan on Ms Marvel
39.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar penned a note ahead of the release of his show 'Ms Marvel'. "I'm proud to be a part of their conscious inclusiveness," he stated. "The show is...celebration of diversity...it certainly will bring joy and pride of self-identity to millions of...girls and boys of the sub-continent," he added. Farhan praised Iman Vellani, who plays the titular role.

40.title: Challenging with cars passing but got ready in 5 mins: Fatima on sea link shoot
40.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said that it was challenging to shoot at the Bandra-Worli sea link with passing cars and less time. "And [there were] no vanity vans. But, it was fun shooting on the streets...Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about my makeover as it would take me just five minutes to get ready," she added.

41.title: Depp's lawyer Camille promoted to partner at firm after Amber Heard trial success
41.article_body: Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez has been elevated to partner at the firm she works with following the role she played as a member of actor's legal team during the defamation trial against Amber Heard. "Camille's performance...proved to the world that she was ready to take this next step now. We are incredibly proud of her," the firm said.

42.title: Spoke to Salman, he said 'You've to do it': Saiee Manjrekar on Major
42.article_body: Actress Saiee M Manjrekar said she discussed her role in Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' with Salman Khan, adding he said she has to do the role. Talking about Adivi, Saiee stated that everyone says he is mean, with her 'Major' co-star Sobhita Dhulipala jokingly terming him as a "torture star". Saiee made her Bollywood debut in 'Dabangg 3' which starred Salman.

43.title: Ukraine urges Israel to sell its Iron Dome rocket interceptor
43.article_body: Ukraine has urged Israel to sell its Iron Dome rocket interception system to help it fight against Russian forces. At a press conference in Tel Aviv, Ukrainian ambassador to Israel Yevgen Korniychuk also asked the country to provide anti-tank missiles. The envoy accused the Israeli government of staying in its comfort zone even as "Russia slaughters our citizens".

44.title: Action taken after Muslim countries protested: Owaisi on BJP leaders’ suspension
44.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that PM Narendra Modi took action against Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal only after Muslim countries raised their voices. "PM Modi took action after Muslim countries protested," Owaisi added. "We are angry that the PM (Narendra Modi) did not pay heed to the Muslims who are residents of this country," he stated.

45.title: RBI hikes repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%, 2nd hike in 2 months
45.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the central bank has raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%. The announcement was made following a three-day meet of the Monetary Policy Committee. The hike comes after the central bank announced a 40 bps increase in repo rate in an off-cycle policy move in May.

46.title: Noida's Supertech twin towers to be demolished on August 21
46.article_body: Noida's Supertech twin towers will be tentatively demolished on August 21, officials said. "The decision has been taken in order to create a buffer period so that the work is completed in any case by August 28," Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari added. This comes after the Supreme Court in May extended the deadline for demolition to August 28.

47.title: BA.5 variant of COVID-19 found in 31-year-old woman in Pune
47.article_body: A 31-year-old woman from Pune was found positive for BA.5 subvariant of Omicron COVID-19 variant, according to the latest report of whole genomic sequencing from BJ Medical College. The woman was asymptomatic and recovered in home isolation. Maharashtra on May 28 had reported its first cases of BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of Omicron in at least seven cases in Pune.

48.title: China's BYD to supply batteries to Tesla 'very soon'
48.article_body: China's BYD is preparing to supply Elon Musk-owned Tesla with batteries "very soon", BYD's Executive Vice President Lian Yubo said. "We are now good friends with Elon Musk," Yubo said. China's CATL is currently the sole supplier of LFP batteries to Tesla, while Panasonic and LG Energy Solutions are the main suppliers of nickel-and-cobalt based cells.

49.title: Would tell Karan 'Please don't think, sit down': Farah on 'Rocky...'
49.article_body: Discussing the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', choreographer Farah Khan said she would ask the film's director Karan Johar to "not think" and just sit down during the film's shooting. "That's how we both are," added Farah. Farah stated there was a "ghost" in her room while shooting in Scotland for 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'.

50.title: 4 held for killing businessman in B'luru, cash & valuables recovered
50.article_body: Police have arrested a gang of four people in connection with the murder of an elderly businessman in his flat in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet and recovered valuables and cash worth ₹4.93 crore. Earlier, police arrested the prime accused Bijaram, who was employed at Jugraj Jain's shop, from Gujarat. The accused and his four accomplices had allegedly murdered Jain on May 24.

51.title: Main focus will be on domestic cricket and IPL: Wriddhiman on Team India snub
51.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha has said that since he won't be picked in Team India squads, his main focus now will be on domestic cricket and IPL. "No, no, it's difficult to devote time to the family. So, I just want to spend some quality time with them now," he said about the possibility of him playing County cricket.

52.title: Which states have most active COVID-19 cases as India reported 40% jump in daily cases?
52.article_body: India on Wednesday reported over 40% rise in daily COVID-19 cases with 5,233 fresh infections. Kerala has the most active COVID-19 cases in the country at 9,857, followed by Maharashtra with 8,432 active cases and Karnataka with 2,478 active cases. Delhi has 1,534 active COVID-19 cases while Tamil Nadu has 927 active cases.

53.title: Norwegian Princess Märtha Louise gets engaged to self-professed shaman Durek, shares pic
53.article_body: Norway's 50-year-old Princess Märtha Louise got engaged to self-professed American shaman Durek Verrett. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Louise wrote, "I'm so happy to announce...I'm engaged to Shaman Durek, the one who makes my heart skip, the one who sees me and acknowledges me from my highest potential, who makes me laugh and who I can be vulnerable with."

54.title: Sonia Gandhi, suffering from COVID-19, seeks more time from ED
54.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has sought more time from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to appear for questioning as she has not yet recovered from COVID-19, reported PTI quoting sources. Gandhi had tested positive for the virus last Thursday. She and her son, Rahul Gandhi, have been summoned by the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

55.title: 17-yr-old killed in Delhi over refusal to give ₹10 for cigarette, 4 held
55.article_body: Police arrested four men for allegedly stabbing a 17-year-old boy to death in Delhi's Anand Parbat after he refused to give them ₹10 for a cigarette. After stabbing, they took out his wallet containing ₹150 and fled, leaving him to die, police said. The investigating team questioned locals and scanned footage from CCTVs where victim's body was found, police added.

56.title: Over 40% jump in daily COVID-19 cases in India with 5,233 infections in 24 hours
56.article_body: India has reported 5,233 COVID-19 cases, 3,345 recoveries and 7 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,714 COVID-19 cases and 7 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 28,857, while the death toll reached 5,24,715.

57.title: Was told 'you're in a hurry, this is temporary': Guj woman on marrying self
57.article_body: Kshama Bindu, a 24-year-old digital creator from Gujarat, who will be marrying herself on June 11, said that her friends asked her to "take time". "[They said] I'm in a hurry and I might change my mind and this is a temporary decision...But I told them that I already took two-three months to think about it," Bindu added.

58.title: US family sues Meta over 19-year-old daughter's eating disorder
58.article_body: A US family has sued Meta over their 19-year-old daughter's eating disorder. Lawyers for Alexis Spence claim that her "addictive" use of Instagram caused her to also suffer from self-harm. The lawsuit cites Facebook Papers, a trove of internal company documents that revealed the tech giant knew Instagram was worsening body-image and other mental-health issues among teenage girls in particular.

59.title: Wanted to highlight social taboo entertainingly: Nushrratt on 'Janhit...'
59.article_body: Speaking about playing a condom seller in her upcoming film 'Janhit Mein Jaari', actress Nushrratt Bharuccha said that they aimed to highlight a "serious social taboo" entertainingly. "Whoever has seen the film has told me that it is not preachy since certain things can be only said this way," she stated. The film will release on June 10.

60.title: BMC to start 1,300 new digital classrooms in Mumbai civic schools
60.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation is planning to start 1,300 new digital classrooms from the current education year across civic-run schools in Mumbai. "We've completed the preparations and...installed all the curriculum on electronic devices," said Joint Municipal Commissioner Ajit Kumbhar. In digital classrooms, different subjects are taught on digital boards through audio-visual content.

61.title: Everyone kept asking me 'Yeh kya banaya': Maker Anees on 'Pyaar...'
61.article_body: Talking about his 1998 Ajay Devgn starrer 'Pyaar To Hona Hi Tha', the film's director Anees Bazmee said, "Everyone kept asking me, 'Yeh kya banaya hai? (What have I made)." "The critics did not tell...if it was a good or a bad film, they simply asked me 'Yeh kya banaya hai?' because...Ajay worked only in action films [then]," added Anees.

62.title: BJP will work to end dynastic misrule in Telangana: PM Modi
62.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met BJP corporators in Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and other party leaders from Telangana. "We had wide-ranging discussions on how to focus on community service endeavours and help people at the grassroots," he said in a tweet. "BJP will work for good governance and ending dynastic misrule in Telangana," he added.

63.title: Man murders canteen staffer after argument over tea in Mumbai
63.article_body: A canteen staffer of a private company was allegedly murdered by an employee of the same firm over serving 'tasteless tea'. The incident took place on Monday night in Mumbai's Bhayandar (East). The duo had reportedly picked up an argument following which the victim complained to the supervisor. This enraged the accused who later allegedly stabbed victim with a knife.

64.title: Pay attention to line and length but don't reduce pace: Irfan to Umran Malik
64.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Umran Malik, who has been named in India's squad for South Africa T20Is, needs to pay attention to his line and length but shouldn't reduce his pace. "Simple advice for him, after every match...[think about] what you have done well and where you have to improve...Sachin Tendulkar [followed] this process," added Irfan.

65.title: Who are the most followed people on Instagram?
65.article_body: Virat Kohli on Tuesday reached 200 million followers on Instagram. Kohli is the 14th most followed person on Instagram. Portuguese footballer Cristiano Ronaldo is the most followed person on Instagram, with more than 451 million followers. He is followed by Kylie Jenner (345 million), Lionel Messi (334 million), Selena Gomez (325 million) and Dwayne Johnson (320 million).

66.title: All 6 accused, including AIMIM MLA's minor son, held in Hyd gang-rape case
66.article_body: All six accused, including five juveniles and one major, have been arrested in connection with the case in which a 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills on May 28, police said on Tuesday. One of the juvenile accused is an AIMIM MLA's son. "Of the accused, four...produced before Juvenile Home...two will be produced today," police added.

67.title: Al-Qaeda threatens suicide bombings in Delhi, Mumbai, UP, Gujarat over Prophet remarks
67.article_body: The Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) has said it would launch suicide bombings in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat to "fight for the honour of the Prophet". This comes after ex-BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal made remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Central intelligence agencies are on alert and all the states have been informed about the threat.

68.title: Pune's 10th child-friendly police station set up in Range Hills area
68.article_body: Pune's tenth child-friendly police station has been set up in Range Hills under the Khadki police station. "Children get scared when they come to police station...such an area is created where policemen are also wearing civil clothes to help these juveniles adjust well to the environment...We are trying to get this system in...all of Pune," Deputy Commissioner of Police said.

69.title: 30-yr-old Delhi man attacks woman friend with knife, consumes acid later
69.article_body: A 30-year-old man allegedly stabbed his woman friend with a knife, injuring her thigh, and later consumed acid in Delhi's Ranhola, police said. The accused recently got married to another woman following which the victim started ignoring him which enraged him, police added. After his marriage, the man kept insisting the victim to continue their relationship, police further said.

70.title: Virat Kohli becomes first Indian to reach 200 million followers on Instagram
70.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the first Indian to reach 200 million followers on Instagram. Sharing a video having his pictures and clips, Kohli wrote on Instagram, "200 million strong. Thanks for all your support Insta fam." Kohli is the third-most followed sportsperson on the photo and video sharing platform after Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

71.title: NHAI sets Guinness record by constructing 75km road in 105 hrs 33 mins
71.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has set a Guinness World Record by constructing "75km continuous bituminous concrete road in single lane on NH-53 section between Amravati and Akola in 105 hours and 33 minutes", Minister of Road Transport & Highways Nitin Gadkari tweeted. Gadkari shared pictures of the road and also posted the Guinness certificate.

72.title: discovery+ launches 'My Daughter Joined a Cult'
72.article_body: discovery+ has premiered a new original docu-series titled 'My Daughter Joined a Cult'. Documenting claims made by ex-devotees, the series follows the life of the controversial and self-styled godman, Swami Nithyananda whilst giving a voice to individuals who were at the epicenter of it all, said the brand.

73.title: ED's recovery is proof of Satyendar Jain's honesty: BJP leader
73.article_body: Criticising Aam Aadmi Party and Satyendar Jain after ED raids, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said the recovery of ₹2.85 crore and 133 gold coins "is proof of Satyendar Jain's honesty". Poonawalla said, "CM Arvind Kejriwal who claims to be the most honest, has not yet been able to take the resignation of his Health-Minister-turned-hawalaat-minister."

74.title: Woman trampled to death by wild elephant in Assam's Nagaon
74.article_body: A woman was trampled to death and another person was critically injured in an attack by a wild elephant at Singimari tea garden area in Assam's Nagaon district, officials said. The woman, Asulata Mallik, was killed in the attack by the wild elephant, while Sapan Mallik was admitted to a local hospital for treatment, officials added.

75.title: Only 2 guards given to Moosewala, while 10 have been given to Lawrence Bishnoi: Richa
75.article_body: Richa Chadha has asked why gangster Lawrence Bishnoi is being given high-level protection while the same was not given to late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Only 2 guards were given to Moosewala while 10 have been remanded to Lawrence Bishnoi, in addition to the best and dangerous bulletproof car of Delhi Police," she tweeted. "#JusticeForSidhuMoosewala," wrote Richa.

76.title: I've seen my chachu Inzamam play here: Imam-ul-Haq on playing in Multan
76.article_body: Speaking about playing his first international match in Multan, Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq stated, "I've always seen my chachu (uncle, Inzamam-ul-Haq) play here. So, I'm very excited." He added, "I was born here and even while coming from the bus, I was remembering how things were in my childhood." Pakistan will face West Indies in first ODI in Multan on Wednesday.

77.title: Will ensure justice for Sidhu Moosewala's family: Rahul Gandhi
77.article_body: Criticising AAP government over the law and order situation in Punjab, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said Congress will ensure justice to the family of Sidhu Moosewala. "It is difficult to express the pain experienced by the parents of Congress leader Sidhu Moosewalaji," he tweeted. Rahul Gandhi met the family of the late singer in Punjab's Mansa on Tuesday.

78.title: 15-day-old infant sold for ₹5.50 lakh in MP’s Indore, 6 arrested
78.article_body: Police arrested six persons from Madhya Pradesh's Indore after a 15-day-old infant was sold for ₹5.50 lakh to a Dewas couple. Police said that those arrested include a minor and two accused are currently absconding. The accused bought home appliances with the money they received after selling the infant, which has been recovered from their possession, the police added.

79.title: ₹1 lakh fine imposed on McDonald's outlet in Ahmedabad over pics of dead lizard in drink
79.article_body: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) imposed a penalty of ₹1 lakh on a McDonald's outlet, two weeks after pictures of a dead lizard in a cold drink served by them went viral. The civic body said surprise checks will be conducted for three months. "After paying...fine, the restaurant will be given two days for cleaning up," an official said.

80.title: Bihar will have road network like America by 2024: Nitin Gadkari
80.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said that Bihar will have a road network like America by 2024. He was addressing an event in Hajipur after inaugurating the eastern flank of the renovated Mahatma Gandhi Setu and also laying the foundation stone of road and bridge projects in Bihar worth ₹13,585 crore.

81.title: Unwise to expect everyone to be available every single game: Dravid on Rohit being rested
81.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma being rested too many times after being named all-format captain, India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "Rohit is our all-format player. It'd be unwise to expect everyone to be available every single game...every single time." He added, "We want to ensure...they are fit for the big tournaments." India-South Africa T20I series will begin on Thursday.

82.title: BJYM leader held in Kanpur for objectionable post on Prophet
82.article_body: Four days after violence broke out in UP's Kanpur, Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha leader Harshit Srivastava was arrested on Tuesday evening for his objectionable tweet on Prophet Muhammad. "We will act against anyone who tries to play with religious sentiments," said Kanpur Police Commissioner Vijay Meena. The police lodged a complaint as soon as the post surfaced online.

83.title: Venezuela's Prez Maduro to arrive on 2-day visit to Turkey from Tue
83.article_body: Venezuela's President Nicolás Maduro will arrive in Turkey on a two-day visit from Tuesday, the Turkish government said. Maduro will discuss regional and global matters with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan during the visit. Notably, Turkey has since 2018 increased its exports to Venezuela, including food and personal hygiene products, amid stiff sanctions by the US.

84.title: Japan to open to foreign tourists after 2-year pandemic closure
84.article_body: Japan will reopen to tourists from June 10 after a two-year COVID-19 closure but will require them to wear masks and avail private medical insurance, government said on Tuesday. Tourists will be chaperoned throughout their stay and only visitors on package tours will be allowed entry during first phase of reopening. International students were allowed entry to Japan in March.

85.title: MLA's minor son accused in case of 17-year-old's gangrape in car in Hyderabad
85.article_body: An AIMIM MLA's son has been named as an accused in the gangrape case of a minor girl in a car in Hyderabad, police said on Tuesday. The MLA's son is a minor and has been named as the sixth accused in the case, police said. All accused, including one adult and five minors, are in police custody, reports said.

86.title: China to offer rewards for info about breach of national security
86.article_body: China has announced that it'll offer cash rewards from 10,000 yuan (nearly $1,500) to over 1,00,000 yuan (about $15,000) for tip-offs on breach of national security under measures introduced this week, state media reported. The government will also provide citizens with special certificates. The amount of the reward will be decided on the basis of the value of the tip-off.

87.title: ABD's only ODI golden duck came after 220 matches, 12 years
87.article_body: Ex-South African cricketer AB de Villiers recorded his first and only ODI golden duck in his 221st match (212 innings) on June 7, 2017, over 12 years after his ODI debut. The then South African captain was caught by Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez off Imad Wasim's bowling in a Champions Trophy match. De Villiers registered seven ODI ducks in his career.

88.title: Karthik has been picked in India's squad to bat at backend of game: Dravid
88.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's role in upcoming T20I series against South Africa, India head coach Rahul Dravid said the wicketkeeper-batter was picked in India's 18-member squad to perform the role of a finisher like he did for RCB in IPL 2022. Karthik scored 330 runs in 16 matches for RCB in this year's IPL at a strike rate of 183.33.

89.title: Ryanair asks UK-bound S African passengers to take language test
89.article_body: Ryanair has mandated UK-bound South African passengers to take a language test in Afrikaans to prove their nationality before travelling. Airline authorities have claimed that the test is an attempt to weed out passengers carrying fraudulent South African passports. Notably, Afrikaans is spoken by 12% of the South African population and was linked to the apartheid era in the country.

90.title: Chhattisgarh is ATM for Congress: BJP on mining at Hasdeo Aranya
90.article_body: Demanding Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo's resignation over the Hasdeo Aranya protests, BJP leader Brijmohan Agrawal criticised Congress and said, "Chhattisgarh is an ATM for the Congress." Agrawal further said that the ruling party 'did not care' about the people of the state. Tribals in Hasdeo Aranya have been protesting against mining inside the area for around 100 days.

91.title: Woman gives birth to identical twins 3 days apart in US, pic surfaces
91.article_body: In a rare occurrence, a woman named Carmen Martinez in Texas gave birth to identical twin daughters three days apart. "They had their own separate placenta and...sac," she said. Martinez said she was advised to delay the birth of her second baby to increase her chance of survival after the first baby was admitted to the NICU after her birth.

92.title: Rajasthan BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal gets notice in 5-yr-old case
92.article_body: The Rajasthan Police has sent a notice to BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal in a five-year-old assault case. Meghwal, who represents the Keshoraipatan assembly constituency, has been asked to appear before the police to cooperate in the investigation. Meghwal is among the BJP MLAs who are camping at a resort in Jaipur ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.

93.title: 5-yr-old UP girl suspected to have contracted monkeypox tests -ve
93.article_body: A five-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, who was suspected to have been infected with monkeypox, has tested negative for the virus. The girl's samples had been sent to Pune's ICMR-NIV for testing. So far, no monkeypox case has been reported in the country. CMO Ghaziabad earlier said the girl had complaints of itching and rashes on her body.

94.title: Vietnam arrests Health Minister, Hanoi Mayor over corruption scandal
94.article_body: Vietnam's Health Minister Nguyen Thanh Long and Hanoi Mayor Chu Ngoc Anh were sacked from their roles and arrested following accusations that they were involved in a COVID-19 test-kit corruption scandal. The scandal involved bribery in exchange for supplying hospitals with overpriced kits. Reportedly, their arrests come amid an intensifying anti-corruption drive that was launched in 2016.

95.title: Stop blaming us for your failure: RSS leader on Kerala CM's remark
95.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar criticised Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan for his comments on former BJP leader Nupur Sharma's statement on Prophet Muhammad, saying he should be 'sued for hate speech'. "Pointing fingers at RSS is equivalent to spitting on the sun...the spit falls on your face," Kumar said. Political leaders should 'stop blaming RSS for their own failures', he added.

96.title: SAD alleges threat to ex-minister Bikram Majithia's life in jail
96.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) on Tuesday alleged threat to the life of former minister Bikram Singh Majithia, who is lodged in the Patiala Central Jail in a drugs case. SAD leaders Maheshinder Singh Grewal and Dr Daljit Singh Cheema also alleged that there was a likelihood of Majithia being implicated in another "false" case. Majithia had surrendered on February 24.

97.title: 12 more arrested in Kanpur violence, total 50 arrests made: Police
97.article_body: Police have arrested 12 more people in connection with Kanpur violence, taking the total number of arrests made to 50, an official said. DCP (East) Pramod Kumar said that a 16-year-old boy surrendered after his picture appeared on posters put up by the police. Violence erupted in parts of Kanpur on Friday in protest against "insulting comments" on Prophet Muhammad.

98.title: Ukraine will fight for all its territory, stalemate no option: Prez
98.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday that the country will fight to recover all its territory occupied by Russian forces, adding that stalemate is "not an option". "We have already lost too many people to simply cede our territory...We have to achieve...full deoccupation," he added. Russian forces have been fighting in eastern Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to seize power.

99.title: I wasn't the favourite in French Open 2022 quarters vs Djokovic: Nadal
99.article_body: Rafael Nadal said world number one Novak Djokovic was the favourite to win their quarter-final match at the recently concluded French Open. "Normally it would have gone differently, but it's true that this place has something special," he added. Nadal, who won French Open for the record-extending 14th time on Sunday, defeated Djokovic 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) in the last-eight.

100.title: 'Waited over 1hr for wheelchair at Delhi airport', says para swimmer; Air India replies
100.article_body: Para swimmer Shams Aalam said he had to wait for over an hour at Delhi airport to get his personal wheelchair after flying on an Air India flight. "I need to use washroom no one supporting," said Aalam on Twitter. After he got the wheelchair, Air India tweeted, "It took some time...as it got delayed due to airport security reasons."

101.title: Man ends life after losing borrowed ₹17,000 in online game in MP
101.article_body: A 23-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh's Indore died by suicide after he lost borrowed ₹17,000 in an online ludo game. The man, Basant Devidas Gavale, was the only son in the family and left a suicide note in which he wrote, "Whatever I am doing, I am doing it voluntarily." Gavale had asked his boss for the money.

102.title: 40-yr-old priest found dead in temple in Raj, idol missing
102.article_body: A 40-year-old priest was found dead and the idol of a deity was reported missing from inside a temple in Rajasthan's Bundi, police said on Tuesday. It is likely that the priest was killed while protecting the idol, said Additional Superintendent of Police (Bundi) Kishori Lal. It is believed that there were two or more attackers, SP Jai Yadav said.

103.title: Sri Lanka to get $55 million loan from India to buy fertilisers
103.article_body: A Sri Lankan official on Tuesday said that Sri Lanka will take a $55 million loan from India to buy fertilisers. The country is currently dealing with a severe economic crisis that has sparked a rise in food prices and also caused food shortages. The decision has been taken ahead of the 'Maha' harvest season in the country.

104.title: Big B liked idea of ancient astras in modern world: Brahmāstra director
104.article_body: 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji has stated that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has always liked the idea of ancient Indian astras in the modern world. The director added, "Mr Bachchan...told me that the concept will work with people." Ayan further said that whoever was approached for the film came on board, be it Alia Bhatt, Nagarjuna Akkineni or Amitabh Bachchan.

105.title: 46-yr-old man arrested for 3 bomb blasts in Manipur's Imphal
105.article_body: Police said a 46-year-old man, Thounaojam Rishi Luwangcha, was arrested in connection with three low-intensity blasts in and around Manipur's Imphal in recent weeks. Imphal West District Superintendent of Police (SP) Ksh Shivakanta Singh said explosives, detonators and cordtex wires were seized from him. Luwangcha said he was paid ₹30,000 for each blast by an armed group, police added.

106.title: Jealous of son, people congratulating me for him not 'Rocketry': Madhavan
106.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has said in an interview that he is "really jealous" of his son Vedaant right now. The actor added, "Every time I meet people...I think that they are coming up to me with a smile because I think they are congratulating me for 'Rocketry' but then they say, 'He not really got the silver but gold'."

107.title: Always nice to play in India against India: SA batter Miller
107.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller said his side are aware that the upcoming five-match T20I series against India will be a challenging one as the hosts have serious match-winners in their team. "It's always nice to play in India against India. Hopefully...we can beat team," he added. The first T20I will be played in Delhi on June 9.

108.title: Man shares pic of fish caught in Russia, Instagram user says 'Looks like a Pokémon'
108.article_body: A deep-sea fisherman shared an image of a creature dubbed 'Frankenstein's fish'. It was shared by Roman Fedortsov, a trawlerman stationed near port city of Murmansk, Russia. The picture shows a translucent white fish, with sunken green eyes and fins that look like torn wings. "Looks like a Pokémon," a comment read while another person wrote, "It...looks like anime eyes."

109.title: 21-yr-old Suved Parkar records 5th highest score on debut in first-class cricket history
109.article_body: Mumbai's 21-year-old middle-order batter Suved Parkar recorded the fifth-highest score on debut in first-class cricket history. Parkar scored 252(447) in the first innings of his team's Ranji Trophy quarter-final against Uttarakhand. Bihar's Sakibul Gani holds the record for the highest score on first-class debut with 341, followed by Ajay Rohera (267*), Amol Muzumdar (260) and Bahir Shah (256*).

110.title: I've practically grown up in BJP, accept & respect its decision: Nupur on suspension
110.article_body: BJP's former National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from BJP over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, said she 'respects and accepts' the party's decision. "I have practically grown up in the organisation," said Sharma. At least 15 nations have condemned the remarks with some seeking a public apology over remarks by Sharma and another ex-BJP leader Naveen Jindal.

111.title: I didn't want to enter films, wanted job with regular pay: Kajol
111.article_body: Actress Kajol has revealed that she had never wanted to join the film industry. The actress said, "I always wanted a job that would give me a regular pay cheque every month. That's the kind of job I had wanted." In an earlier interview, Kajol had said that she didn't think the money in films was worth the effort.

112.title: 28-yr-old man kills father after an argument in J&K, arrested
112.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-old man murdered his father after an argument in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. Accused Joginder Kumar attacked his father in his sleep with a hammer, a police official said, adding that the victim died on the spot. A police team rushed to the spot on getting information and arrested the accused, the official said.

113.title: Focus on building organisation first: Nadda to Andhra BJP leaders
113.article_body: Addressing BJP leaders in Andhra Pradesh, party National President JP Nadda asked the leaders to first focus on building the organisation from the ground level in the state rather than worrying about political alliances. "Remember, we have BJP governments in 18 states, apart from the Centre...We have a strategy for Andhra Pradesh and will do whatever is required," Nadda said.

114.title: Kerala CM, his wife & daughter involved in gold smuggling: Main accused Swapna Suresh
114.article_body: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, on Tuesday claimed CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife Kamala and daughter Veena were involved in the scam. Suresh further said Vijayan's additional private secretary CM Raveendran, then Principal Secretary Nalini Netto and then minister KT Jaleel were also involved. "I've filed a petition seeking protection in the court," she added.

115.title: Kanpur DM Neha Sharma transferred days after violence, Vishak Iyer to replace her
115.article_body: Kanpur Nagar District Magistrate Neha Sharma has been transferred to Local Bodies Department of Uttar Pradesh, days after violence broke out in the district. She will be replaced by CMO Special Secretary Vishak G Iyer. The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday announced the transfer of a total of 21 IAS officers. Last month, the state government transferred 16 IAS officers.

116.title: Magic show held for Rajasthan Cong MLAs in resort ahead of RS polls
116.article_body: A magic show was organised for Rajasthan Congress MLAs who are staying in a resort amid poaching fears ahead of the June 10 Rajya Sabha polls. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot was also present there during the show held on Monday. The Congress had shifted its legislators to Udaipur on June 2.

117.title: UK seeks probe into alleged Ukraine grain theft by Russia amid war
117.article_body: UK's Farming Minister Victoria Prentis on Tuesday called for an immediate investigation into allegations that Russia has been stealing grain from Ukraine. Prentis, who termed the allegations 'very serious', said that she has heard reports of grain theft in southern Ukraine's Kherson region. Ukraine is unable to export wheat supplies due to the Russian blockade of its Black Sea ports.

118.title: We'd want to get best out of Hardik's skills: Dravid ahead of T20Is vs SA
118.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said the side would want to get the best out of all-rounder Hardik Pandya's batting, bowling and fielding skills ahead of five-match T20I series against South Africa. "Hardik's leadership was impressive right through the IPL," he added. Hardik-led GT won IPL 2022 title in their debut season. First T20I to be played on Thursday.

119.title: Ricky Kej's Grammy medallion, stuck in Bengaluru customs, cleared after 2 months
119.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian composer Ricky Kej sought the help of authorities to expedite the clearance of his Grammy medallion. Kej claimed it was stuck with customs department in Bengaluru for over two months. A few hours later, he tweeted, "Thanks to the quick, swift intervention by the Customs of India, my medallion has cleared customs and will be delivered tomorrow."

120.title: Apple to change iPhone connector as EU agrees to single charging port
120.article_body: Apple will have to change the connector on iPhones sold in Europe by 2024 after EU countries on Tuesday agreed to a single mobile charging port for mobile phones, tablets and cameras. European Commission said the decision would make consumers' lives easier and help them save money. "By autumn 2024, USB Type-C will become the common charging port," EU said.

121.title: Who are UP-born billionaire Gupta brothers arrested in UAE on corruption charges?
121.article_body: Rajesh Gupta and Atul Gupta of the wealthy Gupta family were arrested in Dubai on Tuesday for corruption in South Africa. The UP-born brothers had multiple businesses in South Africa including IT, media, mining etc. They enjoyed close ties with former South African President Jacob Zuma and allegedly benefited financially from them. They're also accused of fraud and money laundering.

122.title: Frustrated & angry: Biocon chief on poor condition of B'luru roads
122.article_body: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw recently said she was "frustrated and angry at the lack of responsibility of the MLA, Panchayat and MP of Bengaluru's Anekal taluk and Huskur Gram Panchayat at the Huskur-Sarjapur road's abominable condition". "Why does the government build bus depot and quarters with no road to support it? Shame on all the local politicians," Kiran added.

123.title: Teacher, 22-yr-old student held for molesting minor boys in Kerala
123.article_body: A teacher and a 22-year-old student of an institution, imparting religious education in Kerala's Kannur, have been arrested in a POCSO case for allegedly molesting three minor boys, who went there for religious studies. The parents got to know about the incident when the kids refused to go to school after vacations, an officer said.

124.title: German Foreign Minister tests +ve for COVID during trip to Pakistan
124.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday tested positive for coronavirus during her trip to Pakistan. Baerbock took a COVID-19 test after she noticed that she had lost her sense of taste during lunch today, the German Foreign Ministry said. Notably, Baerbock had met Pakistan's Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari earlier in the day.

125.title: Didn't care on tying, don't care now when I'm 2 up: Nadal on Grand Slam race
125.article_body: Commenting on who will end up with most Grand Slams following his 22nd Slam at French Open 2022, which has put him two clear of Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal stated anything can happen. "I didn't care when we were tied and I don't care now when I'm two up. I just want to keep competing," he added.

126.title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 2.9%, warns of stagflation
126.article_body: World Bank on Tuesday cut its global growth forecast for 2022 by 1.2 percentage points to 2.9% and warned of stagflation. It said the Russia-Ukraine war has compounded damage from COVID-19 pandemic, with many countries likely to face recession. World Bank President David Malpass said such a period of weak growth and high inflation was last seen in the 1970s.

127.title: YSRCP hires I-PAC again ahead of 2024 Andhra Assembly polls
127.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSRCP has hired political strategist Prashant Kishor's Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) for a second time ahead of 2024 state Assembly polls, a party leader has confirmed. "Kishor's colleague...Rishi Raj Singh [along with I-PAC's team] will be working for...YSRCP till...next elections," the leader added. YSRCP won 151 out of 175 seats in 2019 state Assembly polls.

128.title: Govt working at grassroots level for welfare of tribal society: Shah
128.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the government is working at the grassroots level for the welfare of tribal society. After inaugurating the National Tribal Research Institute in Delhi, Shah said that the NTRI will work to realise PM Narendra Modi's vision of "connecting the diversity of tribal societies and other tribal institutions running across the country."

129.title: No batter likes to face 150 kmph ball: Bavuma on facing Umran ahead of T20Is
129.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa T20I series, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma praised Umran Malik, saying he's an "exciting pace bowling prospect" for Team India. Talking about possibly facing Umran, who consistently bowled over 150 kmph in the recently concluded IPL 2022, Bavuma said no batter wants to face a ball at 150 kmph. First T20I will be played on Thursday.

130.title: Mumbai's daily COVID-19 cases rise to 1,242, positivity rate at 7.24%
130.article_body: Mumbai on Tuesday reported 1,242 fresh COVID-19 cases, compared to 676 cases recorded on Monday. The city saw 506 recoveries and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stands at 5,974. The positivity rate dropped to 7.24% from Monday's 9.8%. As many as 74 patients were hospitalised on Tuesday.

131.title: Govt widens CDS selection pool; serving or retd 3-star officers eligible
131.article_body: The Centre has issued three separate notifications amending the rules of Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). Any serving or retired Lieutenant General, Air Marshal and Vice Admiral under the age of 62 years will be eligible for the post. The post is lying vacant since General Bipin Rawat's death.

132.title: Imran Khan's party carried out 'suicide attacks' against Pak: Ex-PM
132.article_body: Former Pakistani PM and PML(N) leader Shahid Khaqan Abbasi has accused ex-PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) of being responsible for "suicide attacks" against the country. "The decisions [PTI] made...last month...[and] the manner in which they breached the IMF deal...were...suicide attacks," Abbasi said. He also accused Khan's administration of neglecting Pakistan's energy sector.

133.title: 2 people dead after shooting in German supermarket: Police
133.article_body: Two people were found dead after a shooting in a supermarket in central Germany on Tuesday, the police said. There was no danger to the public, the police added. Witnesses reported that a man shot a woman in the supermarket and immediately afterward apparently killed himself, according to a police statement.

134.title: India's FY23 economic growth forecast cut to 7.5% by World Bank
134.article_body: The World Bank on Tuesday cut India's FY23 economic growth forecast to 7.5% from 8% estimated earlier in April. It cut the forecast due to "headwinds from rising inflation, supply chain disruptions, and geopolitical tensions offsetting buoyancy in the recovery of services consumption from the pandemic". World Bank had trimmed the projection for India from 8.7% to 8% in April.

135.title: Govt proposes panel to override decisions of social media firms in new draft IT rules
135.article_body: In a new draft of its Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines & Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021, the government has proposed a committee with powers to override the decisions of all social media companies. The proposed Grievance Appellate Committee will be able to veto the decisions of grievance officers of intermediaries. The government will hold public consultations in mid-June.

136.title: My mom Tanuja was always scolding me while growing up: Kajol
136.article_body: Actress Kajol has revealed that her mother veteran actress Tanuja was always scolding her when she was growing up. Kajol further said, "She would always be lost in her own world. And if you tell her something, she would stare at you with her big eyes." The actress added that she was scared of her mother growing up.

137.title: 3 arrested for selling drugs on a fake e-commerce site in Gujarat
137.article_body: The Anti-Terrorism Squad of Gujarat said they arrested three men from Ahmedabad on Monday for selling narcotics and psychotropic substances through a fake e-commerce website. An ATS officer said that the accused sent the drugs in boxes used by a leading e-commerce company and used encrypted text messages to cover their tracks.

138.title: US, S Korea & Japan fly fighter jets amid tensions with N Korea
138.article_body: The US, South Korea and Japan on Tuesday flew fighter jets in two separate exercises over waters surrounding the Korean Peninsula amid tension with North Korea. Notably, warplanes were flown amid US Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman's visit to South Korea. Sherman arrived in Seoul to discuss actions by North Korea, including a possibly imminent North Korean nuclear test.

139.title: Skye Air Mobility begins drone trials for medicine delivery in Kerala
139.article_body: New Delhi-based drone startup Skye Air Mobility, along with Aster DM Healthcare, has initiated trials for delivering essential medicines and critical lab samples from Kozhikode to Areekode in Kerala using drones. A statement read that the medicinal supplies will be delivered across approximately 30 kilometers. After completion of the five-day trial, Skye Air aims to undertake about 50 flights.

140.title: PM after AAP, but God's with us: Kejriwal on ED raids against Jain
140.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) found ₹2.85 crore in cash and gold coins weighing 1.8 kg after raiding Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aides' premises, CM Arvind Kejriwal said "The PM is after AAP with all his power." "You [PM] have the power of all the agencies, but God is with us," the AAP chief added.

141.title: Terrorists involved in Kulgam bank manager's murder identified: IGP
141.article_body: Inspector General of Police Kashmir Vijay Kumar on Tuesday said that terrorists involved in the murder of a bank manager in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam have been identified and will be neutralised soon. The victim, who hailed from Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, was shot dead inside bank on June 2. His murder was the eighth targeted killing in Kashmir since May 1.

142.title: Root has gone far ahead of Kohli, Smith, Williamson: Karim
142.article_body: On being asked if Joe Root is ahead of Virat Kohli, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson based on his performance, Saba Karim said the England batter has gone "far" ahead of the other three batters in the last two years. Root recently became the 14th player in cricket history and second England player to complete 10,000 runs in Tests.

143.title: Suspected Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist arrested from Bengaluru
143.article_body: A suspected Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist has been arrested from Bengaluru's Okalipuram in a joint operation by Jammu and Kashmir Police and Indian Army's Rashtriya Rifles. According to officials, the accused had been living in the city for past two years. The suspect was allegedly involved in recruitment of cadre and was part of terror conspiracies in Kashmir, police said.

144.title: Gurugram man arrested for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi gang member
144.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday for posing as a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang and making a threat call to the chairman of a private school in Gurugram, police said. Upset over failing his class 10th examination in 2019, the accused threatened to kidnap and murder the chairman of Guru Dronacharya School JP Yadav, Gurugram Police said.

145.title: Pune court sends man held for Lashkar-e-Taiba links to judicial custody
145.article_body: A Pune court on Tuesday sent Mohammed Junaid Mohammed Ata, who was arrested for his alleged involvement in funding and recruitment for Lashkar-e-Taiba, to judicial custody. The 28-year-old had been working at a scrap dealer shop in Dapodi. The Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad (ATS) had arrested him on May 23.

146.title: I pity women in your life: Swara to troll saying 'Amber deserved that'
146.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker reacted to a troll who tweeted, "I like you but Heard deserved that," after she shared an article about the Amber Heard-Johnny Depp defamation case. She responded, "Nobody deserves to be sexually assaulted...I pity the women in your life." Swara also shared a 2020 article on Depp losing his libel case against The Sun's "wife-beater" claim.

147.title: College student fights off robber who molested her on Mumbai train
147.article_body: A 20-year-old college student fought her molester off and got him arrested after he tried to rob her inside a local train in Mumbai on Monday. The accused had boarded the ladies' compartment and tried to snatch the woman's bag when she was waiting to get off the train. In the scuffle, both of them fell off the stationary train.

148.title: 23 K'taka students suspended for staging protest to wear hijab
148.article_body: The Uppinangady Government First Grade College management suspended 23 girl students, who staged a protest demanding permission to wear hijab inside classrooms last week. The Karnataka High Court in March stated that the hijab isn't an essential religious practice in Islam, making it mandatory for everyone to wear uniforms provided by the educational institutions.

149.title: Ukraine must not be pressured into a bad peace deal, says UK PM
149.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson has said that Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy must not be pressured by world powers into accepting a bad peace deal with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The world must avoid any outcome where Putin's unwarranted aggression appears to have paid off, he added. Johnson also said that Britain would "remain at the forefront" of support for Ukraine.

150.title: Delhi Metro extends train timings for India-SA T20 match spectators
150.article_body: Delhi Metro has extended timings of last trains on all lines except the Airport Express Line to facilitate spectators during the India-South Africa T20 match. Delhi Metro will be performing nearly 48 extra trips by extending its last trains' timings by about 30-45 minutes on June 9. Last train on Violet Line from Kashmere Gate will start at 12:00 am.

151.title: Delhi Police bust illegal arms gang, seize 10 country-made pistols
151.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police busted an illegal arms gang and arrested one person, said an official release on Tuesday. Police recovered five semi-automatic pistols, 10 country-made pistols and four live cartridges from his possession. The gang is involved in supplying illegal arms and ammunition in Delhi-NCR and Western Uttar Pradesh, according to the Delhi Police.

152.title: Salman's statement recorded over death threat letter, actor denies dispute with anyone
152.article_body: Mumbai Police has recorded the statement of actor Salman Khan in connection with a letter threatening him and his father, an official said on Tuesday. In his statement, he denied threat from any person, threat calls or a dispute with anyone in the recent past. Police had earlier enhanced the security around the actor's residence in Bandra.

153.title: Theme park exclusively for women, kids inaugurated in Hyderabad
153.article_body: A theme park built exclusively for women and children has been inaugurated at Kukatpally Housing Board Colony (KPHB)-Phase 3 in Hyderabad. Only women and children under the age of 10 years are allowed in the park. It has dedicated play areas for children, an open gym, walking paths, a yoga space and an area exclusively marked for kitty parties.

154.title: YouTuber Roddur Roy arrested for 'derogatory' remarks against Mamata
154.article_body: YouTuber Roddur Roy was arrested in Goa on Tuesday for allegedly making derogatory remarks against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Roy will be brought to Kolkata on transit remand, a senior police official said. He had reportedly made the remarks during a Facebook live programme, following which TMC spokesperson Riju Dutta had filed a complaint against him.

155.title: Request media not to associate public appeal with us: Sidhu's family
155.article_body: Late Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's family has requested the media not to associate any public appeals with them amid his murder investigation. "Whatever appeal will be made on behalf of Sidhu's family will be done via his official Instagram handle," their statement read in Punjabi. Sidhu was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on May 29.

156.title: Bicycle thief arrested in Navi Mumbai, 25 stolen bicycles seized
156.article_body: The Panvel city police arrested a 35-year-old bicycle thief and recovered over 25 stolen bicycles from him. Police said the accused, Dinesh Ramdas Jadhav, was a porter in a market and started stealing bicycles to make extra money. A team under Senior Inspector Vijay Kadbane worked on the modus operandi and with a tip-off, arrested the accused, the police said.

157.title: Mumbai won't flood even if it rains at 60-70 mm/hour: BMC official
157.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Additional Municipal Commissioner P Velrasu has said that even if Mumbai receives rain at the rate of 60 to 70 mm per hour, there will be no waterlogging. However, if the rainfall exceeds this limit, there will be flooding, he added. BMC has dealt with 73% of flooding spots in the city, Velrasu said.

158.title: CBIC to destroy 42,000 kgs of narcotics across 14 locations on Wed
158.article_body: The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has announced that it'll destroy about 42,000 kilograms of narcotics as part of its 'Drug Destruction Day' on Wednesday. The narcotics will be destroyed across 14 locations in the country. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will virtually witness the destruction in Guwahati, Lucknow, Mumbai, Mundra, Kandla, Patna and Siliguri.

159.title: Delhi to witness ongoing heatwave till June 9: IMD
159.article_body: Delhi will witness the ongoing heatwave at isolated places till June 9 and the temperature will remain between 44-46°C, IMD Senior Scientist RK Jenamani said. Cloudy conditions and drizzle is expected on June 11 over northwest India and parts of central India due to a western disturbance. He added that the heatwave will abate from June 11.

160.title: Nitin Gadkari, other Union ministers seen in bus at Patna airport
160.article_body: Union minister Nitin Gadkari's office took to Twitter to share a picture of him sitting in a bus at Patna's Jay Prakash Narayan International Airport, along with Union ministers Ashwini Kumar Choubey and Shandilya Giriraj Singh, among others. Gadkari is on a one-day visit to Bihar. Bihar Deputy CMs Tarkishore Prasad and Renu Devi were also seen in the picture.

161.title: Man shoots estranged wife dead in alimony dispute in Pune
161.article_body: A 45-year-old man allegedly shot dead his estranged wife and injured his mother-in-law following a dispute over alimony in Pune district's Shirur, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Dipak Dhawale, who travelled to Shirur for a court hearing, opened fire at the victim and her mother. Dhawale fled in an auto after the shooting but was nabbed by police.

162.title: Man destroys ₹40 cr in rare museum artifacts after fight with girlfriend in US
162.article_body: A 21-year-old man in US broke into the Dallas Museum of Art and destroyed ancient antiquities worth a total of $5 million (around ₹40.37 crore) after a fight with his girlfriend, police said. A sixth-century Greek statue and a pot dating back to 450 BC were among items destroyed by Brian Hernandez. He was caught smashing them using a stool.

163.title: Maharashtra Board to announce Class 12 result at 1 pm tomorrow
163.article_body: The Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education will announce the Class 12 result on Wednesday. Minister for School Education Varsha Gaikwad said the result will be declared at 1 pm. After the online examination for the last two years due to COVID-19, students appeared for the exam offline this year.

164.title: COVID trying to crawl back into our lives: Sonnalli on testing +ve
164.article_body: Actress Sonnalli Seygall announced on Tuesday that she tested positive for COVID-19. She wrote in a social media post, "Finally after 2 yrs I have contracted the virus. I am isolating and recovering. This msg is also a reminder that covid is trying to crawl back into our lives, so mask up guys!" Earlier, actor Kartik Aaryan tested COVID-19 positive.

165.title: Want to see who's selling golgappas in train: Sanjay Gupta on 'Laal..' scene
165.article_body: Talking about a scene where Aamir Khan can be seen eating a golgappa in the trailer of his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', director Sanjay Gupta tweeted, "I'm dying to see...who is selling golgappas in a moving train." 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a remake of Tom Hanks' 1994 American film 'Forrest Gump' and also stars Kareena Kapoor, Naga Chaitanya, Sharman Joshi.

166.title: Wanted to build something from scratch: Stoinis on signing for LSG in IPL
166.article_body: Revealing the "big reason" behind signing for debutants LSG in IPL 2022, all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he wanted to build something from scratch. "Have a blank canvas to work with, in...company of someone like KL Rahul and Sanjiv Goenka to build something that you can look back on in 10-15 years," he added. LSG lost in the Eliminator to RCB.

167.title: Diljit offered me Honsla Rakh, Shehnaaz ended up doing it: Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia
167.article_body: Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia revealed that she was offered a role in Diljit Dosanjh-starrer 'Honsla Rakh' while she was working on the show 'Choti Sarrdaarni'. "It was Diljit sir who'd reached out himself...He texted me...and asked if I'd test for a part," she said, adding, "Shehnaaz (Gill) ended up doing it...Lot of things didn't work out, COVID was at its peak."

168.title: Ukraine must demine its coast for grain to be exported: Russia
168.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said Ukraine must demine the approaches to its ports in order for ships to be cleared by Russian military before they could export grain, Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters. Russia has blockaded Ukrainian ports, disrupting the export of grains from Ukraine. Earlier, Ukraine accused Russia of stealing grain from occupied areas and selling it.

169.title: Right now he is Australia's best T20I fast bowler: Watson on Hazlewood
169.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson named Josh Hazlewood as Australia's best T20I pacer currently, saying it's amazing to see his evolution as a T20I bowler over the last two years. "Always thought he was just a Test and one-day bowler because he didn't have that many defensive options in T20 cricket," he added. Hazlewood has taken 40 T20I wickets so far.

170.title: Fan in Lalu Yadav's room in Jharkhand catches fire, none injured
170.article_body: A fire broke out in a room of the circuit house in Jharkhand's Palamu where RJD chief and former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav was staying, officials said. Prasad was having breakfast in his room when the fan caught fire due to a short circuit, they added. The fire was immediately doused by his aides and no one sustained injuries.

171.title: Prophet remarks not made by any govt functionary, no impact on govt: Goyal
171.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said that remarks against Prophet Muhammad by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma do not have any impact on the government. "I don't think that this statement was made by any government functionary and therefore it has no impact on the government and necessary action has been taken by the party," Goyal added.

172.title: Number of Left Wing Extremism-hit districts down by 70% since 2014: Shah
172.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the number of districts affected by Left Wing Extremism (LWE) has declined by 70% since 2014. "The government also lifted the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) from more than 66% [of the] area in the Northeast," he added. Separately, Shah inaugurated the National Tribal Research Institute (NTRI) in Delhi today.

173.title: 2 killed, 1 severely injured after house wall collapses in Gujarat
173.article_body: Two people died and one was severely injured after the wall of an old dilapidated house collapsed on them in Gujarat's Sabarkantha district. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Babu Patel was getting his new residence constructed adjacent to his old house. While Babu and 28-year-old labourer Harsh Barada were declared dead, the other labourer suffered injuries, an official said.

174.title: 133 gold coins, ₹2.8cr cash found in raid on Delhi minister & his aide; pics released
174.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has found 133 gold coins weighing 1.8 kg and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of arrested Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide. The seized cash and gold were acquired from unexplained sources, ED said. Various incriminating documents and digital records were also found, it added.

175.title: Artefacts from Ukraine invasion displayed at museum in Kyiv
175.article_body: Artefacts recovered from ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine are being shown to visitors at a museum in Kyiv.
