Items including missiles, food rations and helmets, along with personal notes and credit cards of Russian soldiers killed on the frontlines have been put on display. "You can see and touch the war with your fingertips here," curator Yuriy Savchuk said.

176.title: Originally planned to have wedding with Nayanthara in Tirupati: Vignesh
176.article_body: Filmmaker Vignesh Shivan said that he and actress Nayanthara had originally planned their wedding to be held in Tirupati. "We were even ready to make arrangements, but we felt it won't work out logistically. Therefore, we decided to have it in Chennai. It's a close-knit ceremony with family members and close friends," he added.

177.title: Noida Police rescues 2 girls from Jharkhand trafficked as housemaids
177.article_body: Two minor sisters who were trafficked as housemaids in Noida have been rescued by the police, officials said on Monday. Notably, a couple in Noida had employed them through an agency. "The police had inputs that the girls were kept as slaves and forcefully made to work in the household...after which the action was taken," a police spokesperson said.

178.title: Chennai woman kills self after losing money in online gambling
178.article_body: A 29-year-old woman died by suicide in Chennai on Sunday after she allegedly lost money on an online gaming platform. According to the police, the woman, Bhavani, had a habit of playing online rummy for the past one-and-a-half years and had begun investing more in past four months after initially earning profit. She had reportedly lost over ₹10 lakh.

179.title: Policybazaar-owner PB Fintech shares crash over 15% on CEO's stake sale plan
179.article_body: Shares of PB Fintech, which owns Policybazaar, crashed over 15% in Tuesday’s intraday trade after its CEO Yashish Dahiya proposed to sell around 37 lakh shares through the open market. The shares hit an intraday low of ₹557 on the BSE, 15.4% down from its previous close, while on NSE it touched ₹556, 15.6% down from its previous close.

180.title: For 15 days after heart surgery, I became extremely humble: Sunil Grover
180.article_body: Actor Sunil Grover stated that he became extremely humble and full of gratitude for 15 days after his heart surgery, having suffered a heart attack. "I had become very sweet," added Sunil. Discussing the lessons he has learnt, Sunil stated, "If you can drink water when you want [and] sit up on your bed by yourself, you are lucky."

181.title: Talk isn't a problem, casteism is: Dalit activist after Google cancels her talk
181.article_body: Dalit rights activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan, whose talk on caste bias was cancelled by Google, said a talk on casteism isn't the problem, casteism itself is. "Every part of Google's reaction (to the talk) reflects that they need to do caste equity," Soundararajan said. "I just wish Google had given us the chance to show them the other way," she added.

182.title: K'taka BJP will face 2023 polls under collective leadership: Yediyurappa
182.article_body: BJP leader and former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Tuesday said the 2023 Assembly elections in the state will be fought under 'collective leadership'. "As voters are with PM Narendra Modi and...BJP, there will be no hurdles in our path towards victory," he said. Yediyurappa added that he is committed to travelling across the state to strengthen the party.

183.title: Inclusion is firm foundation underlying our constitutional architecture: VP Naidu
183.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said that underlying our constitutional architecture is the firm foundation of "inclusion", of leaving no one behind. "It is the vision that finds an echo in the overarching philosophy of the present government, led by Prime Minister Modi that believes in 'sabka sath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas and sabka prayas'," he added.

184.title: Man from Tamil Nadu held for threatening to blow up 6 RSS offices
184.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has arrested a man from Tamil Nadu for threatening to blow up at least six RSS offices, including two in Uttar Pradesh. The ATS will bring the suspect to Lucknow on transit remand. A man associated with RSS was added to a WhatsApp group, where a discussion regarding the bomb blasts was underway, police said.

185.title: Man who disguised himself as Moosewala's fan & clicked selfie among 8 arrested
185.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested 8 people so far in connection with murder of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. A man who disguised himself as a fan and clicked selfies with Sidhu Moosewala and shared information with the shooters has also been arrested. SIT has also identified four shooters of Sidhu Moosewala.

186.title: NCW takes cognisance of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case
186.article_body: National Commission for Women Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Tuesday said that the commission has taken cognisance of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped when she was returning home after a party in the Jubilee Hills area on May 28. "The matter is serious because minor girls are being targeted," she said.

187.title: Amije Forever Tomar: Kartik as 'Bhool...' crosses ₹200-cr mark globally
187.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, taking to Instagram on Monday, shared box office figures of his latest film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. In his post, he mentioned that the horror-comedy film has earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office and ₹154.82 crore in the Indian market. "Amije Forever Tomar (I am forever yours)," Kartik wrote.

188.title: Russian envoy walks out of UN meeting as EU blames Moscow for food crisis
188.article_body: Russia's UN ambassador walked out of a UN Security Council meeting after European Council President Charles Michel blamed Moscow's invasion of Ukraine for causing a global food crisis. Michel said Russia's using food supplies as "stealth missile against developing countries". "You may leave the room, maybe it's easier not to listen to...truth," Michel told Vassily Nebenzia as he walked out.

189.title: Not afraid: Mamata on terrorist group KLO chief's reported threats
189.article_body: After banned terrorist group Kamatapur Liberation Organization (KLO) chief reportedly threatened West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee with a "bloodbath" if she opposed the group's demand for a separate state, she responded by saying, "Some people are threatening me, I'm not afraid." In a purported video message to Banerjee, KLO chief had said, "Beware. Don't step on the soil of Kamatapur."

190.title: Chaddis do chaddi work: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah on RSS
190.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised RSS saying "chaddis do chaddi work" and asked why the post of the organisation's chief has never been occupied by a Dalit. "I am telling you from the beginning that RSS is a non-secular organisation," he said. Siddaramaiah is talking about such things because he doesn't have any other subject, said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai.

191.title: Pakistan asks Qatar for more LNG amid fuel crisis: Report
191.article_body: Pakistan has asked Qatar for additional shipments of Liquified Natural Gas (LNG) amid its ongoing fuel crunch, Bloomberg has reported quoting sources. This comes amid recent reports that the Pakistani government was mulling reducing the number of working days in a bid to conserve fuel and foreign exchange. Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves have reportedly fallen below $10 billion.

192.title: Ajay shares fans' comments for 'Legend of Bhagat...' on film's 20th anniversary
192.article_body: Ajay Devgn on Tuesday marked the 20th anniversary of 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh' by sharing a series of fan comments about the film on his Instagram account. "This movie will always be close to my heart," a fan wrote, while another commented, "Got...tears while watching...[it]." "Even after 20 years...#TheLegendOfBhagatSingh remains a film...I'm proud to have associated with," Ajay wrote.

193.title: SEBI may use US casinos-like AI tech against insider trading: Report
193.article_body: SEBI is in talks with a US-based AI firm to develop Vegas casinos-like AI tech to catch insider trading, Economic Times reported citing sources. If the deal goes through, the company will customise the software according to the requirements of SEBI. The company has given a live demonstration to SEBI as to how the software will work.

194.title: Congress aims to politicise textbook issue: K’taka Education Minister
194.article_body: Amid the textbook issue in the state, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said Congress aims to "politicise" the textbook issue for elections. "For the last 65 years, they were teaching false things to the students," Nagesh added. "Congress, everyday, is coming down. Whatever false agenda they have given to the people, it is coming out now," he stated.

195.title: Cong burning RSS chaddi as theirs has been stripped: Pralhad Joshi
195.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said Congress is "burning RSS chaddi (knicker)...because people have stripped [Congress'] chaddis". This comes after Congress' youth wing NSUI set fire to a pair of RSS knickers to protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks in Karnataka. People have taken Congress' chaddis off in front of the entire country in Uttar Pradesh, Joshi added.

196.title: 1 booked for insulting national flag ahead of Kejriwal's Guj rally
196.article_body: Police have registered an FIR against an unidentified person for allegedly insulting the national flag ahead of AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat. A video has surfaced in which the accused was purportedly seen putting his feet on the Tricolour on a roadside, where some flags were kept for distribution to AAP supporters, police said.

197.title: Syria claims Israel fired missiles at its military sites
197.article_body: Syria has claimed that Israeli forces fired multiple missiles at its military sites south of Damascus. It added that the attack caused some material damage but there were no casualties as it shot down most of the missiles. UK-based war monitor Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said that the missiles targeted sites where pro-Iran Shiite militias are located.

198.title: Man pushes woman onto subway tracks; New York Police shares video
198.article_body: New York Police Department (NYPD) has shared a video on Twitter showing a man pushing a 52-year-old woman onto the subway tracks in the Bronx. The suspect is still at large and NYPD has offered up to $3,500 (₹2,71,932) to anyone who can give any information on the whereabouts of the suspect. The incident took place on Sunday, June 5.

199.title: South makes mass content, north makes class content: Jay Shewakramani
199.article_body: Producer Jay Shewakramani has commented on the north-south cinema debate, saying that south cinema makes mass content while Hindi filmmakers cater to class audience. He further said, "If one wants to do outstanding numbers in Hindi, we need to meet the demands of both spectrums." Jay added 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' is a perfect example of Hindi cinema acing this balance.

200.title: UP CM wants to create state where people feel safe: BJP leader
200.article_body: BJP leader Ashok Bajpai said CM Yogi Adityanath has made constant efforts against criminals in UP. "CM wants to create a state where the rule of law will prevail and people of every society feel safe and secure," Bajpai added. Action is being taken against criminals at district level so that UP can become a crime-free state, he stated.

201.title: Mumbai woman asked to repay ₹3,000 loan, her morphed pics circulated
201.article_body: A 22-year-old woman got abusive messages from 14 phone numbers after she was asked to repay a loan of ₹3,000 that she took from an online application. Her morphed pictures were also circulated to people in her contact list. Reports said that the woman had seen an advertisement for the loan application called 'Kreditloan' on YouTube.

202.title: Salman Khan leaves for film's shoot amid death threat, spotted with police security
202.article_body: Salman Khan was on Monday spotted with police security at the Kalina airport in Mumbai, a day after the actor received a death threat letter. Reports suggested that he will be resuming the shoot of his upcoming film. On Monday, Mumbai Police visited Galaxy Apartments, Salman's house in Bandra, and increased the security around the building.

203.title: I'm sad, can't sleep: Djokovic's coach on his French Open loss vs Nadal
203.article_body: Talking about world number one Novak Djokovic's defeat against Rafael Nadal in the French Open 2022 quarter-final, Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic said, "I can't sleep...I am sad." "I am in a funk," added Goran. Nadal defeated world number eight Casper Ruud in the Roland Garros 2022 final. He won the French Open for a record-extending 14th time.

204.title: Amit Shah inaugurates National Tribal Research Institute in Delhi
204.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday inaugurated the National Tribal Research Institute (NTRI) in Delhi. The NTRI will act as the premier national institute for the promotion and preservation of tribal culture and heritage. "We may think it is just another institution, but such institutions have a role in nation-building," Amit Shah said while addressing the inaugural ceremony.

205.title: India ranks lowest among 180 countries in global environment performance index
205.article_body: India occupies the last spot in the 2022 Environmental Performance Index released recently based on an analysis by Yale and Columbia University researchers. The Index ranked 180 countries using 40 indicators of environmental health. Pakistan and Bangladesh were also among the bottom 10 countries in 176th and 177th spots, respectively. Nepal, Sri Lanka secured 162nd and 132nd ranks, respectively.

206.title: People didn't recognise me at 'Janhit Mein Jaari' screening: Nushrratt
206.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha stated that she isn't successful, adding people didn't recognise her at the screening of her film 'Janhit Mein Jaari'. "I went for a show last night and I had to say that I am Nushrratt Bharuccha," she added. Nushrratt further said that she has yet to reach the stage where people go to theatres to watch her.

207.title: India became global superpower in last 8 yrs under PM Modi: Harsh Vardhan
207.article_body: PM Modi has transformed India from a third-world country into a global superpower in the last eight years, said former Union Minister Harsh Vardhan. "It's only because of [PM's] people-centric policies that people have renewed their faith in democracy," Vardhan said on Tuesday. He further claimed that India is well poised to become the world's third-largest economy by 2030.

208.title: 24 K'taka college students banned for 7 days from classes over hijab
208.article_body: As many as 24 students have been banned for seven days from attending classes in Karnataka's Government First Grade College, Uppinangady in Dakshina Kannada district for wearing hijab, as per college authorities. The students allegedly refused to attend classes without taking off their hijab. This comes almost a week after six students were suspended for wearing hijab.

209.title: Heavy rains, floods affect over 8 lakh people in China
209.article_body: Heavy rains and the resulting floods affected more than eight lakh people in China's Jiangxi province. As many as 80 counties of the province were reportedly impacted. According to the authorities, over 76,000 hectares of farmland was damaged, causing an estimated loss of about 1.16 billion yuan. The Level-IV emergency response was lifted on Tuesday after rains subsided.

210.title: PhysicsWallah, founded by a teacher who refused ₹40 cr job from Unacademy, turns unicorn
210.article_body: Edtech firm PhysicsWallah has become India's 101st unicorn after it raised $100 million in its Series A funding, taking the company’s valuation to $1.1 billion. Founded by Prayagraj-based teacher Alakh Pandey, PhysicsWallah began as a YouTube channel by him in 2016. Reportedly, after starting his channel, Pandey also refused a ₹40-crore per annum job offer from Unacademy.

211.title: Armaan Malik collaborates with Ed Sheeran for new version of '2Step'
211.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has collaborated with British singer Ed Sheeran for the latest version of the latter's song '2Step'. "I'm...excited to be featured on this version of '2step' with Ed Sheeran! He has always been...an inspiration, and I'm a big fan of his music and...songwriting," Armaan stated. "This will be the beginning for...more collaborations of this nature," he added.

212.title: Will shed my blood but never allow division of Bengal: CM Mamata
212.article_body: Amid demands for a separate state carved out of West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said she's ready to shed her blood but will never allow a division of the state. "With elections approaching, BJP is fanning the demands of separate statehood, sometimes seeking Gorkhaland and at other times a separate state of North Bengal," she said.

213.title: Maharashtra Police summons Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
213.article_body: The Maharashtra Police has summoned suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on June 22 for allegedly making derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad during a television debate. Police have asked Sharma to record her statement in connection with her remarks. The Mumbra Police in Maharashtra's Thane district had registered an FIR against Sharma following her remarks.

214.title: Pune's Sarasbaug to get hawker zones amid anti-encroachment drives
214.article_body: Pune's Sarasbaug area will get dedicated zones for hawkers and food stall owners amid ongoing anti-encroachment drives. "At the meeting arranged by hawkers with the municipal commissioner...on Monday, we sought a plan for development of Sarasbaug," NCP’s Ashwini Kadam said. Pune’s civic body will allocate a budget for area in next financial year, Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

215.title: Punjab Cong MP gets call threatening 'same fate as Moosewala', security increased
215.article_body: Punjab Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu on Tuesday received a call on WhatsApp, saying he would meet the "same fate" as his late party colleague and Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. Bittu's personal security staff have confirmed the receipt of the threat call and his security has reportedly been enhanced.

216.title: Chris Rock not concerned with Jada's remark on reconciliation: Report
216.article_body: Following Jada Pinkett Smith's remark on Chris Rock and Will Smith reconciling after the 2022 Oscars slap incident, Entertainment Tonight has quoted a source reporting that Chris Rock is "not concerned" with it. "He's not concerned with the Smiths at the moment. He's touring and he's preparing for a comedy special," the source was quoted as saying.

217.title: Happy birthday queen: Actress Kangana Ranaut to Ekta Kapoor
217.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, taking to Instagram Stories, wished Ekta Kapoor on her birthday. Kangana shared a picture of Ekta in her story and wrote, "Happy birthday queen." Kareena Kapoor also wished Ekta on her Instagram Stories. On Instagram, Mouni Roy wrote, "Your birthday is always the perfect opportunity for thanking you for always inspiring...being the light you've been in my life."

218.title: Pune airport authority to start cargo facility on 1.75-acre land
218.article_body: Pune International Airport authority has decided to start a cargo facility on the 1.75-acre land. "The Defence Ministry had approved to transfer land in March, the hand over process is remaining," an airport official said. "The ministry is yet to submit its plans. Once we receive the plans, the procedure for land allocation will start," the official added.

219.title: Right-wing activist booked in UP for 'ban Friday prayers' remarks
219.article_body: A case has been registered against Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha national secretary  Annapurna Bharti, alias Pooja Shakun Pandey, in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh for seeking a "ban on  Friday prayers". Additional City Magistrate (First) summoned her with a notice. While replying to the notice, she denied making any provocative statements.

220.title: Over 60 people fall sick after eating food at wedding in Maha
220.article_body: Over 60 people fell sick after eating food at a wedding in Maharashtra's Yavatmal, a medical official said on Tuesday. The guests complained of uneasiness and started throwing up after consuming the food, he added. About 40-45 guests were taken to a hospital in the neighbouring district, while 20-25 were treated at a local health centre.

221.title: I-T portal not hacked, Infosys fixing issue: Govt as site suffers glitch on anniversary
221.article_body: The government said that there was no data breach on the Income Tax e-filing portal after its search option malfunctioned on the first anniversary of its launch. "Infosys has been directed to look into it and...has confirmed that they are resolving the issue on priority," said the Income Tax Department on Twitter.

222.title: British band Queen to drop unreleased Freddie Mercury song in September
222.article_body: An unreleased song by Freddie Mercury, recorded for his rock band Queen's 13th studio album The Miracle, will come out in September this year. Calling the song a "little gem from Freddie", Queen's Roger Taylor said that they had "kind of forgotten" about it. "It's wonderful, actually. It was a real discovery," Taylor further said.

223.title: Foakes is best wicketkeeper in the world: England Test skipper Stokes
223.article_body: Praising Ben Foakes, England Test skipper Ben Stokes said his teammate is "best wicketkeeper in the world". He added that having Foakes behind the stumps gives him and bowlers a lot of confidence. Stokes said bowlers know that nine times out of 10, Foakes is going to take everything that comes to him. Foakes has played 12 Tests so far.

224.title: 8 held for running parking racket near Gurugram's Galleria market
224.article_body: The Haryana Chief Minister's flying squad in a joint raid on Monday held eight people for allegedly running a parking racket near the Galleria market in Gurugram. An official from the flying squad said the accused had been running the racket for two months and collected at least ₹20,000-25,000 every day. The area is earmarked for free parking, officials said.

225.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial wristbands put on sale online for over ₹3.8 lakh
225.article_body: Several spectators who attended the defamation trial between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard in US' Virginia are now selling their paper wristbands online for over ₹3.8 lakh. "This is a piece of celebrity culture history," wrote one seller. The jury found that Heard defamed Depp and awarded him $10 million in compensatory damages and $5 million in punitive damages.

226.title: I played French Open with my left foot asleep because of anaesthetic injections: Nadal
226.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who won French Open for the 14th time, revealed that he played Roland Garros 2022 with his left foot asleep. "I played with no feeling in the foot...because of the anaesthetic injections into the nerve," he said. The 36-year-old added that it was "probably" the most unexpected title for him.

227.title: How does the latest Cricket World Cup Super League points table read?
227.article_body: After defeating Zimbabwe by eight wickets in the second ODI, Afghanistan jumped to the third position on the Cricket World Cup Super League points table. The table is being led by Bangladesh, while England are placed second. Zimbabwe are 12th with just three victories. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

228.title: Juvenile home in UP's GB Nagar overcrowded: Officials
228.article_body: Officials of District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) on Monday observed that the juvenile home in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar is overcrowded. "A total of 142 'children in conflict with law' are detained in the observation home, but the total capacity is 100," juvenile home Superintendent Dharmendra Maurya said. Notably, children from other districts are also being kept at the facility.

229.title: Pitt accuses Jolie of inflicting harm on him by selling her stake in $28 mn wine firm
229.article_body: Brad Pitt has accused his ex-wife Angelina Jolie of trying to intentionally inflict harm on him by damaging the reputation of their jointly owned wine business, Château Miraval which they bought for $28.4 million in 2008. Pitt alleged that Jolie sold her stake to a company while having agreed to never sell their respective stakes without each other's consent.

230.title: Hyd police book BJP MLA for revealing gang-rape victim's identity
230.article_body: Hyderabad police have booked BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao for allegedly revealing the identity of the 17-year-old gang-rape victim. According to the FIR, the complainant claimed that Rao had addressed a press conference related to the gang-rape case and released videos and pictures which revealed the minor's identity. This may have caused the victim "colossal distress", the complainant also stated.

231.title: Had my first drink with my parents, their friends: Nushrratt Bharuccha
231.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha said she had her first drink with her parents and their friends, adding that her entire family has been very open, progressive and supportive. Nushrratt stated that the conversation on sexual awareness happened in a "very normal" way in her house. Nushrratt will be next seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari' where she plays a condom salesgirl.

232.title: There never was one like you: Meghana on Chiranjeevi Sarja's death anniversary
232.article_body: Meghana Raj took to Instagram to pen a note remembering her husband, Chiranjeevi Sarja, on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of herself with Chiranjeevi and wrote, "You and me...for eternity. There never was one like you, and there will be none like you...You, Chiru...the one and only." Chiranjeevi passed away in 2020, after suffering a heart attack.

233.title: Pune woman to attempt non-stop cycling from Leh to Manali in 60 hours
233.article_body: Pune's ace ultra-cyclist Preeti Maske will be attempting a World Ultra Cycling record by pedalling from Leh to Manali within 60 hours. "I am training hard for this Leh-Manali non-stop high-altitude expedition," Preeti said. Reports said that she admitted that the most challenging part of the Leh-Manali expedition is sleep deprivation as it is a continuous, non-stop ride.

234.title: Special intro scene being designed for SRK in Salman’s Tiger 3: Report
234.article_body: A special introduction scene is being designed for Shah Rukh Khan's cameo in Salman Khan-starrer 'Tiger 3', a source close to the development told Pinkvilla. "The details of [the introduction scene] have been kept under wraps for now," the source added. The source stated that Salman will have a chopper-bound entry in Shah Rukh's 'Pathaan'.

235.title: Hardik is extremely valuable for India, can hit sixes anytime: Irfan
235.article_body: Irfan Pathan said Hardik Pandya is "extremely valuable" for Team India and can hit sixes anytime. "He has the ability to finish the game at...death, he can do that batting up the order as well," he added. Hardik, who last played for India in November 2021, has been named in India's 18-member squad for upcoming T20I series against South Africa.

236.title: Arjun replies as man comments he can 'never get in shape', says 'I don't hide behind pic'
236.article_body: Arjun Kapoor replied to an Instagram user after the latter said he can "never get in shape". "So, according to...you, being in shape is just having cuts on...body. The shift in mentality, the ability to show up and push hard...isn't the point of working out, right?" said Arjun. "I don't hide behind a pic of a torso," he added.

237.title: 8 of family killed, 1 injured as SUV collides with truck in Rajasthan
237.article_body: At least eight people of a family were killed and another was injured after the SUV they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck in Rajasthan's Barmer, police said. The victims were going to a wedding and the accident took place when they were only eight kilometres away from their destination, police added. The deceased included two minors.

238.title: Meta appoints Guy Rosen as its chief information security officer
238.article_body: Meta has appointed Guy Rosen as its first Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). In a memo seen by Reuters, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said he had asked Rosen to take on the role. Rosen said he "will continue to oversee and look across the breadth of safety and security risks the people who use our services...face".

239.title: ED seizes assets of Gupta Builders & Promoters in money laundering case
239.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday said it has seized an Audi car, ₹85 lakh in cash and documents during raids against Chandigarh-based Gupta Builders and Promoters in an alleged money laundering case. The builders are accused of cheating investors of ₹325 crore. ED's probe has found that homebuyers' money was used to purchase various personal assets by the firm's directors.

240.title: Google loses defamation case against Australian politician, told to pay $515,000
240.article_body: Google has been ordered to pay $515,000 (around ₹4 crore) to an Australian former lawmaker after losing a defamation case filed by him. An Australian court found that the company intentionally made money from two YouTube videos attacking and mocking John Barilaro, who was the then-deputy premier of New South Wales. They featured a comedian who accused Barilaro of corruption.

241.title: Nick Jonas limps to emergency room over softball injury, video viral
241.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows singer Nick Jonas limping into an emergency room in California's Encino after suffering an injury during a softball game. Nick appeared to be hit in the groin during the game on Sunday and nearly collapsed on the field. His brother Kevin Jonas drove him to the hospital in a Land Rover.

242.title: Cinema is my oxygen, Vikram's success is not just mine but good cinema's: Kamal
242.article_body: The official handle of Raaj Kamal Films International shared a video of actor Kamal Haasan thanking all the film lovers for their support towards his new film 'Vikram'. He said that cinema is his oxygen and the success of 'Vikram' is not just his but also a win for good cinema. He added 'Vikram' has been given success by viewers.

243.title: MVA leaders should contact us for support in RS polls: Owaisi
243.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said no one from the ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in Maharashtra has asked them for support in the upcoming elections to six Rajya Sabha seats. "If they want our support, they should contact us," Owaisi added. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena MLC Ambadas Danve said MVA leaders will soon decide on Owaisi's proposal.

244.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha holds door-to-door campaign ahead of bypolls
244.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha held a door-to-door campaign on Tuesday ahead of Assembly bypolls in the state. Saha, who replaced ex-CM Biplab Kumar Deb last month, is contesting bypolls from the Town Bardowali constituency and filed his nomination papers on June 6. Bypolls to Town Bardowali, Agartala, Surma and Jubarajnagar are scheduled to be held on June 23.

245.title: UK journalist & indigenous expert missing in Amazon rainforest
245.article_body: A British journalist and a Brazilian indigenous expert have gone missing while reporting in a remote area of the Amazon rainforest near Brazil's border with Peru. According to rights groups, Dom Phillips, a regular contributor to the Guardian newspaper, and Bruno Pereira had received threats before they went missing. Brazil's federal police and the Navy are searching for the duo.

246.title: 2 YouTube channels booked, blocked for inciting unrest in UP via fake news
246.article_body: A case has been registered against two YouTube channels for allegedly inciting communal agitation by streaming "misleading" news about the imposition of curfew and riots in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, officials said. The channels 'RA Knowledge World' and 'Bareilly Production' have also been blocked. "An attempt was made to disturb the communal situation of the city," a senior police officer said.

247.title: Pune reports 50% rise in COVID-19 cases in one week
247.article_body: Pune has reported a 50% rise in COVID-19 cases in the week from May 30 to June 5. The city saw 538 new infections during this period as compared to 357 cases between May 23 and May 29, as per the health department data. Mumbai, Pune and Thane have the maximum number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, it added.

248.title: 'Ardh' shows husband-wife relationship, struggle of common man: Rajpal
248.article_body: Actor Rajpal Yadav has spoken about his upcoming film 'Ardh', saying that it depicts the relationship of a husband and wife and their day-to-day struggle to live a normal life. He further said that the script showcases the struggle of a common man. "There are many people like (my character) Shiva who are struggling for their dreams," the actor added.

249.title: Mumbai's COVID-19 positivity rate exceeds pre-3rd wave figures
249.article_body: The current COVID-19 test positivity rate in Mumbai over the past week has exceeded five times that of December 2021, during the beginning of the third wave. Over the last week, 54,164 tests were conducted in Mumbai and 4,732 people tested positive, taking the positivity rate to 8.7%. Between December 21-27, last year, the positivity rate was recorded at 1.7%.

250.title: Meesho sends legal notice to marketing firm CEO over smear campaign: Report
250.article_body: E-commerce unicorn Meesho has sent a legal notice to the CEO of an influencer marketing company who was allegedly involved in a smear campaign against Meesho on social media, Moneycontrol reported. The cease and desist notice has asked the influencer marketing manager to reveal who he was working for. He has also been asked to take down all defamatory content.

251.title: Police arrest 28-yr-old tenant for robbing landlord's house in Hyderabad
251.article_body: The Nacharam Police along with Malkajgiri Central Crime Station team apprehended a 28-year-old man for allegedly carrying out robbery at his landlord's house in Hyderabad. Police also seized 53.9 tolas of gold ornaments, 166 grams of silver ornaments and cash worth ₹1,50,000. According to police, the accused committed the theft when the victim and her husband were away in Tirupati.

252.title: Man dies as tyre detached from truck hits him in Chennai; video surfaces
252.article_body: A man walking along a road was killed after a tyre detached from a truck hit him in Chennai, with video of the incident surfacing on social media. The incident took place when the man was walking towards his home after buying groceries. The police have detained the truck driver for questioning.

253.title: Anti-encroachment drive carried out on ₹65 cr-land in Greater Noida
253.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) on Monday carried out an anti-encroachment drive on land worth ₹65 crore, officials said. Five bulldozers were used during the drive, which went on for four hours. "People had constructed boundary walls in empty plots covering large portions...The identities of the colony residents are unknown," GNIDA public relations officer said.

254.title: Leopard rescued from well using 'charpai' in Pune; video surfaces
254.article_body: A video of a leopard being rescued from a 45-foot-deep well using a 'charpai' (woven bed) in a village in Pune's Junnar has surfaced online. The rescue operation was conducted by the Maharashtra Forest Department and non-profit Wildlife SOS after villagers found the leopard and informed them. The leopard was released after a few hours of observation, Wildlife SOS said.

255.title: Vidyut's 'Khuda Haafiz 2' gets postponed, will release on July 8
255.article_body: The release date of Vidyut Jammwal and Shivaleeka Oberoi-starrer 'Khuda Haafiz - Chapter II Agni Pariksha' has been postponed and will now release on July 8. Taking to Instagram, Vidyut announced the new release date for the film. The film was initially set to release on June 17. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film 'Khuda Haafiz'.

256.title: Monsoon to arrive in Mumbai by June 11, conditions favourable: IMD
256.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted June 11 as the date of the onset of monsoon in Mumbai and said the conditions have become favourable over the city. "We'll have to wait for it to enter south Konkan and Goa before it reaches Mumbai," an official said. Mumbai is likely to experience a good rainfall post mid-June, he added.

257.title: Finalise deal, fill potholes immediately: HC tells B'luru civic body
257.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Monday ordered Bengaluru's civic body BBMP to finalise its contract with a private firm to fill the potholes across the city immediately. The court order came after BBMP agreed to pay ₹551 per square metre to the company to fix potholes. BBMP has been asked to submit a zone-wise status report within 10 days.

258.title: Panel of lawyers to assist Moosewala's family free of cost: DBA Mansa
258.article_body: The District Bar Association (DBA) of Punjab's Mansa on Tuesday said that a panel of lawyers will legally assist Sidhu Moosewala's family free of cost in his murder case. "We have also presented a resolution that no advocate will represent the accused in the case," DBA added. Moosewala was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Mansa on May 29.

259.title: Joe Root is England's best ever, now Sachin should watch out: Vaughan
259.article_body: Talking about Joe Root, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Root is England's best ever - now Sachin Tendulkar should watch out." "He could surpass Sachin's record for the most Test runs," added Vaughan. Root recently became the joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 runs in Tests, overtaking Sachin who reached the mark at the age of 31 years and 326 days.

260.title: Scared to go out for groceries; don't know if we'll be alive: Kashmiri Pandit
260.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit said that the members of the community are scared to go out of homes to buy groceries and medicines. "Offices are closed now...Our children have also stopped going to school because you never know what will happen," the Kashmiri Pandit said, adding, "We see a bleak future for our kids in Kashmir."

261.title: 'Borat...' actress Maria Bakalova to star in 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'
261.article_body: Maria Bakalova, known for her role in 'Borat Subsequent Moviefilm', is set to star in Marvel Studios' 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'. Confirming the news on her Instagram handle, the Oscar-nominated actress wrote, "Honestly...I'm the happiest most excited person ever!!!!" The James Gunn directorial, also starring Chris Pratt and Zoe Saldana, is scheduled to release in May 2023.

262.title: British woman raped in front of partner in Goa; accused arrested
262.article_body: A British woman visiting Goa was allegedly raped in front of her male partner at Sweet Water Lake near Arambol beach. The incident occurred on June 2. The accused, a 32-year-old local identified as Joel Vincent D'Souza, allegedly raped the middle-aged woman on the pretext of giving her a massage. D'Souza has been arrested, said police.

263.title: B'desh depot fire that killed 41 brought under control after 3 days
263.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has been brought under control after three days, an official said on Tuesday. "The fire hasn't been put out completely but there's no risk of further explosion," fire service official Monir Hossain told Reuters. Authorities suspect a container of hydrogen peroxide was the source of disaster.

264.title: India doesn’t need lecture from any nation on religious tolerance: Cong leader
264.article_body: Following ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress' Jaiveer Shergill said India doesn't need a lecture from any nation on religious tolerance. "BJP must realise that our secular identity shouldn't be dented for cheap political gains and TRP sensationalism...India's identity as vibrant, multi cultural habitat must stay forever!" Shergill tweeted.

265.title: There was no one to share the journey with for me back then: Jay Sean
265.article_body: Singer Jay Sean has stated that his journey in the music industry has been a "beautiful one" and added that he has accomplished "a lot" through the years. He added, "There just wasn't anyone to share the journey with for me back then...I often felt alone out there without a peer network or support system."

266.title: The craziest, weirdest blockbuster I've ever seen: Doctor Strange writer on RRR
266.article_body: American screenwriter C Robert Cargill, who penned Benedict Cumberbatch starrer film 'Doctor Strange', took to Twitter to praise SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. "Friends came over last night to initiate me into the cult of RRR...and I'm here to report I'm now fully, truly, deeply a member," Cargill wrote, adding, "This is the craziest, most sincere, weirdest blockbuster I've ever seen."

267.title: I do see myself taking more playback singing opportunities: Aparshakti
267.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana said he does see himself taking more playback singing opportunities in future, however, while having a "dedicated" acting career. "I'm still...new to music...I'm...three songs old...the love I have received for all three of the songs has been overwhelming, to say the least," he stated. "I love singing...as much as I move along and watch films," Aparshakti added.

268.title: Fintech startup Rupeek fires nearly 180 employees citing business reassessment
268.article_body: Bengaluru-based fintech startup Rupeek has fired 10-15% of its employees as the company reassess its business structure. While the firm didn’t mention the exact number of affected employees, it reportedly has a total of 1,200 employees and nearly 180 are estimated to have been fired. "Subdued macroeconomic environment...compelled us to re-calibrate our strategy, relook at our costs," Rupeek said.

269.title: As expected, SRK didn't even thank me for supporting Aryan: Shatrughan on drugs case
269.article_body: Talking about supporting Aryan Khan in drugs case, actor Shatrughan Sinha said, "As expected...I didn’t receive a thank you card from Shah Rukh Khan." He further said he was "maybe" the most prominent voice standing up for Aryan. "SRK should've gotten in touch with me. But, to be fair to him, he didn’t ask me for support either," Shatrughan stated.

270.title: List of achievements of PM Modi-led govt in 8 years shared by Harsh Goenka
270.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a list of achievements of PM Narendra Modi-led government in eight years. The list showed how India climbed up in ranking in various fields such as automobile production, steel production, mobile phone production, and global innovation index. Goenka mentioned the source of the data as Bloomberg, MSCI, IMF and Kotak MF.

271.title: Sri Lanka needs $5 billion in 6 months for essentials: PM Wickremesinghe
271.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government will need at least $5 billion in the next six months to maintain basic standards of living, including some $3.3 billion for fuel imports. "Only establishing economic stability isn't enough, we have to restructure the entire economy," Wickremesinghe, who's preparing an interim budget to balance Sri Lanka's battered public finances, said.

272.title: Not important: Kerala Guv on Qatar's demand for apology over Prophet remarks
272.article_body: As Qatar sought the Indian government’s apology over former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said that "it is not important". "People are entitled to their opinions. How does it matter? That (demand for apology) is not important," Khan added. "India cannot bother about such small reactions," he stated.

273.title: Jaffer was my favourite player, placed him above other legends: Hardik
273.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said former Team India opener Wasim Jaffer was his favourite cricketer while growing up. "I used to love watching him bat. [He was] someone I always placed...above other legends," added Hardik. "I used to copy his batting but I was never able to get his class," stated Hardik. Jaffer played 31 Tests for Team India.

274.title: Security cover provided to ex-BJP leader after rape threats over remarks on Prophet
274.article_body: The Delhi Police has provided security cover for former BJP leader Nupur Sharma and her family after she received rape and death threats over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad. The Delhi Police has also sent a notice to Twitter to join the investigation and help the police. The BJP on Sunday suspended Sharma over her controversial comments.

275.title: Didn't request ₹500 ticket cost, those making remarks about me lack logic: Nani
275.article_body: Ahead of release of his film 'Ante Sundaraniki', actor Nani said that he did not ask for a ticket price of ₹500 and that those making "disparaging" remarks about him due to ticket pricing "lack basic logic". "They mash up things...Somebody will say something...others will copy it...I simply stated...industry cannot survive on...pricing model of ₹20, 40 and 60," he added.

276.title: HDFC Bank hikes lending rate by 35 bps across all tenors from today, EMIs to go up
276.article_body: HDFC Bank has hiked its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 35 basis points across all tenors, effective June 7. As a result of the hike, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more expensive. The bank has hiked its MCLR by 60 basis points since the RBI hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points in May.

277.title: I'd planned a special preview of 'Toolsidas...' for dad & Rajiv Kapoor: Maker
277.article_body: Mridul Mahendra, director of 'Toolsidas Junior', has said that he had planned a special screening of the film for his father and actor Rajiv Kapoor. "Unfortunately, Rajiv sir left us in February last year and soon after that, even my father passed away," he added. Mridul further said 'Toolsidas Junior' depicts one of the most cherished parts of his life.

278.title: J&K Police fire at drone, recover 3 magnetic IEDs near Indo-Pak border
278.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Monday recovered three magnetic IEDs packed in children's tiffin boxes after firing at a drone in Kana Chak area near the India-Pakistan border. The incident occurred while a police party was deployed in the area after BSF also fired at a drone the same day. The IEDs' timers were set to different timings, police said.

279.title: Called me a w***e, said he will break my feet: Haaland on Milošević
279.article_body: Norwegian striker Erling Haaland alleged that Swedish defender Alexander Milošević called him a "w***e" and said he would break his feet, during the UEFA Nations League match between Norway and Sweden. Haaland added he scored a minute and a half after Milošević threatened to break his feet. Haaland scored a brace as Norway defeated Sweden 2-1. Milošević denied the allegations.

280.title: China says Australian aircraft threatened its sovereignty
280.article_body: China has accused an Australian military aircraft of seriously threatening its sovereignty and security. This comes after Australia said a Chinese aircraft flew dangerously close to one of its own during a routine surveillance activity in May. A Chinese government spokesperson said the countermeasures taken by the Chinese military were reasonable and lawful.

281.title: Kerala govt should take responsibility for lack of cleanliness in Kochi: Goyal
281.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said Kochi is lagging in cleanliness and state government along with local bodies should take responsibility for it. "I also love Kochi. But...I don't love it when in...short span of time it falls from fifth rank to 324 in the swachhta index," Goyal said. The minister is on a two-day visit to Kerala.

282.title: Things are different after pandemic: Sonu on 'Samrat...' collection
282.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about the box office collection of 'Samrat Prithviraj', has said, "It might not have got as much business as expected." "But, we have to accept that things are a bit different after the pandemic," he added. Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' has domestically earned around ₹44 crore since its release on June 3, as per trade estimates.

283.title: I'd finalised Akshay for 'Phool...', Ajay oozed confidence in audition: Director
283.article_body: Director Kuku Kohli revealed that he'd finalised Akshay Kumar as the lead actor for 'Phool Aur Kaante'. He added Akshay "couldn't allot bulk dates" as he'd started shooting for another film around the same time. "Then...I saw Ajay Devgn's picture in his dad's office...I auditioned [him]...and he oozed confidence," Kuku said. The film marked Ajay's debut in the film industry.

284.title: Will carry out suicide attack if Imran Khan harmed: Pak lawmaker
284.article_body: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party lawmaker Attaullah has threatened to target the country's current rulers and their children with a suicide attack if even "a single hair" on party Chairman and ex-PM Imran Khan's head is harmed. Thousands of more partymen are ready to carry out such attacks, Attaullah said. This comes amid reports that a conspiracy is afoot to assassinate Khan.

285.title: Just after my 3rd international match, Dhoni said I will be in World Cup team: Hardik
285.article_body: Hardik Pandya revealed that just after his third international match in 2016, MS Dhoni told him he'll be in India's T20 World Cup squad. "I didn't even bat...but he assured me that you've expressed yourself. It was...a dream come true," Hardik added. He stated he thought he wouldn't get to play after conceding 21 runs in his first international over.

286.title: Italy summons Russian envoy over media coverage criticism
286.article_body: Italy on Monday summoned the Russian ambassador to protest over allegations by Moscow that the Italian media were allegedly involved in an "anti-Russian campaign" amid the Ukraine-Russia war. "We reject [such] insinuations," Italy's Foreign Ministry said. "We [also] firmly reject accusations of amorality" levelled at certain Italian officials and journalists by Russian Foreign Ministry, it said.

287.title: Gerard Pique sent intimate messages to me, Shakira didn't deserve this: Brazilian model
287.article_body: Following Gerard Pique and Shakira's breakup, Brazilian model Suzy Cortez claimed that the footballer used to send her intimate messages on Instagram. She added that Pique used to ask her when she would return to Europe and also used to ask how much her butt measured. "Shakira didn't deserve this," the model further said.

288.title: RSS workers start 'chaddi' campaign after K'taka Congress' 'burn-the-chaddi' campaign
288.article_body: After Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah asked party workers to start 'burn-the-chaddi' campaign, RSS workers launched a house-to-house collection drive for "chaddis" to send them to Congress leaders' homes. Congress students' wing NSUI were seen setting fire to a pair of khaki knickers, which are associated with RSS, in their protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks.

289.title: 'Deadpool 3' is not going to be the Disney-fied Deadpool: Writer
289.article_body: 'Deadpool 3' writer Rhett Reese, speaking about the film being made under the banner of Disney, said, "These people [in Disney] do things their way." Reese added, "We were used to doing things our way...there are differences." However, he stated people in Marvel have been supportive. "They're gonna let Deadpool be Deadpool...this isn't going to be...Disney-fied Deadpool," he added.

290.title: Woman seeks bulletproof jacket for jailed gangster son, HC rejects plea
290.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court rejected a plea filed by the mother of an alleged gangster seeking a bulletproof jacket for him, both inside and outside the jail. Her son is presently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail. "This court would refrain from passing any directions...since the petitioner's son is lodged in a jail beyond this court's jurisdiction," HC said.

291.title: Lot of people in Indian setup feel Rahul isn't a natural leader: Pollock
291.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Shaun Pollock said a "lot" of people in the Indian setup have said that batter KL Rahul is "not" a natural leader. Pollock added that Rahul is also considered a "reluctant" captain by them. Rahul will lead India in the upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli have been rested for the series.

292.title: China asks international community to stop sending arms to Ukraine
292.article_body: Chinese envoy to the UN Dai Bing on Monday asked the international community to stop sending weapons to Ukraine. He said that constantly providing weapons or imposing sanctions against Russia will not solve the problem but will expand the conflict. "China once again calls on the parties concerned to put international and regional peace and security first," he added.

293.title: Take action against those spreading hate: Vijayan on remarks against Prophet
293.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday urged the Centre to take action against those "propagating hate and trying to destroy the secular fabric of our country." "Sangh Parivar forces have brought our country...to a state of embarrassment in front of the world," he added. Vijayan's remarks came after several countries condemned ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

294.title: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi meets Sidhu Moosewala's family
294.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday met the family of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on May 29, at his village Moosa. Moosewala joined Congress in December 2021 and contested the 2022 Punjab Assembly elections from the Mansa constituency. "Deeply shocked...by the murder of promising Congress leader and talented artist, Sidhu Moosewala," Gandhi had tweeted earlier.

295.title: 16-yr-old girl killed, another hurt after car hits bicycle in Delhi
295.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was killed and another girl was seriously injured after an alleged speeding car hit a bicycle they were riding near Kanjhawala in Delhi on Monday. The car driver, who drove away after the accident, was arrested, police said. "The...girls were rushed to a nearby hospital, where one of them was declared dead on arrival," DCP (Rohini) said.

296.title: 2 women steal jewellery under pretext of shopping in Pune; arrested
296.article_body: Pune's Dattawadi police have arrested two women, aged 29 and 31, for allegedly stealing jewellery under the pretext of shopping and also seized a mangalsutra from the accused. One of the accused has 22 cases filed against her for stealing under the guise of buying bullion. The police set a trap and caught the duo on the Pune-Satara road.

297.title: Ananya to star opposite Akshay in C Sankaran Nair's biopic: Report
297.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday will reportedly play a lawyer alongside actor Akshay Kumar in C Sankaran Nair's biopic. A report by Mid Day stated Akshay will play the role of a late lawyer-activist. The film will reportedly be based on Raghu and Pushpa Palat's book 'The Case That Shook the Empire'. The film will be directed by Karan Singh Tyagi.

298.title: Done to please foreign leaders: Owaisi on suspension of BJP leaders
298.article_body: Following BJP's move to suspend Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said it was done to "please leaders of foreign countries". "This issue had become big in the Gulf countries, so under compulsion, PM of the country took action against his national spokesperson," Owaisi added. "You want to please the leaders of foreign countries," he stated.

299.title: Struggled a lot for 'Main...', SRK made me wait for 3 years: Farah
299.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan said she "struggled a lot" to direct her first film which was the 2004 Shah Rukh Khan starrer 'Main Hoon Na'. "Shah Rukh...made me work for it and he made me wait for three years," added Farah. "I'd ask myself, 'Why am I not making a film?'. I'd wake up with angst in my heart," stated Farah.

300.title: Heatwave warning for Delhi, IMD asks people to 'venture out carefully'
300.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has a heatwave warning for Delhi. "Severe heatwave from June 4 in Haryana, Punjab, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and parts of Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan. Temperature varying between 44°C-47°C. Shall continue for four more days," an IMD scientist said, adding that people should venture out carefully as the heat spell is very severe.

301.title: Extremely serious matter, will help you: Varun Dhawan to fan alleging abuse by her father
301.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan vowed to help a female fan after she alleged domestic abuse by her father. The fan tweeted that her father abuses her and her mother "every single day". She added the authorities haven't taken a strict action against him. Calling it an "extremely serious matter", Varun wrote, "If this is true...I'll help...you and speak to the authorities."

302.title: Madhavan shares throwback pic with wife on wedding anniversary, pens note
302.article_body: Actor R Madhavan wrote a note for his wife Sarita Birje as the couple celebrated their 23rd wedding anniversary on Monday. Sharing a throwback picture with his wife on his Instagram Stories, Madhavan wrote, "How is it that I am more in love with you now than ever before and I am just getting started...Happy anniversary wifey."

303.title: Was born with a crooked neck, people called me ugly: Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta
303.article_body: Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta spoke to 'Humans of Bombay' about her life before becoming one of the youngest CEOs in India at the age of 33. "I was born with a crooked neck…people always told me how ugly I looked," she said. She added that at the age of 22, she had suicidal thoughts after facing multiple job rejections.

304.title: I have no hand in this matter: Gangster Bishnoi on threat letter to Salman Khan
304.article_body: Delhi Police has questioned jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in connection with the threat letter to actor Salman Khan. Bishnoi told police that he has no hand in this matter and does not know who issued the letter. The threat letter received by actor Salman and his father Salim Khan allegedly stated, "Tumhara Moosewala kar denge (you'll end up like Moosewala)."

305.title: Fire breaks out at bank in Supreme Court, no casualties reported
305.article_body: A minor fire broke out at a UCO Bank branch inside the Supreme Court premises on Tuesday and no casualties were reported. It was brought under control by 10.05 am by five tenders, Delhi Fire Services said. The fire spread to the false ceiling, air conditioning unit and office files in the records room of the bank, officials added.

306.title: How much will the new Apple MacBooks cost in India?
306.article_body: Apple has announced new MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with M2 chip. While they will be available in India next month, MacBook Air with M2 will start at ₹1,19,900 and the 512GB storage option for the MacBook Air will cost ₹1,49,900. The 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip will start at ₹1,29,900 and the 512GB MacBook Pro will cost ₹1,49,900.

307.title: Former Sony CEO Nobuyuki Idei dies of liver failure at 84
307.article_body: Former Sony CEO Nobuyuki Idei died of liver failure on June 2, aged 84, the company said. Idei joined the company in 1960 and served as CEO from 1998 to 2005. He held leadership roles in Sony's audio, home video and creative communication divisions. Idei stepped down in 2005 to take responsibility for slumping earnings.

308.title: PM to lay foundation stone for B'luru Suburban Rail project on June 20
308.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone for the Bengaluru Suburban Rail project on June 20, said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday. According to the latest blueprint, the project will span a rail network of 148.17 km, with 57 stations planned across four corridors in six directions of Bengaluru. The project is expected to be completed by 2026.

309.title: Bengal man chops off wife's hand after she gets job as govt nurse
309.article_body: A man and his two accomplices allegedly chopped off his wife's hand in West Bengal's Purba Bardhaman after she got a job as a nurse at a government hospital. A case has been registered in the matter. "The accused...put a pillow on [woman's] face to muffle her screams and then chopped off her...hand," an official said citing the complaint.

310.title: Priyanka shares pic with Anne Hathaway, BLACKPINK's Lisa; fans react
310.article_body: Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share a picture with Anne Hathaway and BLACKPINK singer Lisa from an event in Paris. "And then there was us...girls just wanna have fun," Priyanka wrote. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "Three of...best ladies in...world have come together!" Another fan wrote, "Anne, Pri and Lalisa in one frame!!!!!!!!!! I'm not...dreaming, am I?"

311.title: Ukrainian women, girls facing sexual violence, trafficking: UN
311.article_body: Ukrainians, especially women and girls, are being subjected to sexual violence in the war-torn country, which is turning into "a human trafficking crisis", said Pramila Patten, the UN special envoy for sexual violence in conflict. She said the UN human rights office received 124 complaints of conflict-related sexual violence, out of which 97 involved women and girls.

312.title: Wife, son stab Punjab man 15 times, kill him for demanding money; FIR filed
312.article_body: A 49-year-old man, Kulwinder Singh, died after he was allegedly stabbed 15 times by his wife and son. Reports said his wife, Satnam Kaur, told police he was an alcoholic who hurt himself after collapsing in "drunken state". However, stab wounds were found on Singh's body, after which, his son admitted to stabbing him for demanding money to purchase alcohol.

313.title: Sena MLAs moved to unknown hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls on June 10
313.article_body: Shiv Sena has moved a group of its MLAs and some independent candidates to an unknown hotel ahead of the Maharashtra Rajya Sabha polls for six seats. The move is a preventive measure to dismiss any possibility of horse-trading by the BJP ahead of the polls. Sena has nominated Sanjay Raut and Sanjay Pawar for the Rajya Sabha polls.

314.title: Zomato likely to sign Blinkit's acquisition deal on June 17: Reports
314.article_body: The Zomato board is likely to meet on June 17 to sign off Blinkit's acquisition, as per reports. While the deal earlier valued Blinkit at $700 million, the final value is expected to be lower as this would involve a stock swap in a 1:10 ratio, where Zomato would get 10 shares of Blinkit for every one of its shares.

315.title: My dream role is Kangana's character in 'Queen': Akansha Ranjan Kapoor
315.article_body: Akansha Ranjan Kapoor, speaking about her dream role, said, "It has always been Kangana Ranaut's character in the film 'Queen'." She further stated, "I love that [Kangana's] character. But I remember before 'Guilty', I wanted to play something like that. So it keeps changing." Akansha made her debut in the 2020 film 'Guilty'.

316.title: Kashmiri Pandits had to migrate twice when BJP was in power: Kejriwal
316.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has criticised BJP over targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits in Jammu and Kashmir, claiming, "In the last 30 years, Kashmiri Pandits had to migrate twice and both happened when BJP was in power." He called the killings a "massacre". Last week, Kashmiri Pandits held protests and threatened mass migration over targeted killings in the valley.

317.title: BJP govt made 'mockery of plight of unemployed Goans': AAP leader
317.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party leaders have criticised BJP-led Goa government for backtracking on its promise of employing youths in government jobs. Goa AAP Vice-President Surel Tilve alleged the government has made a "mockery of the plight of unemployed Goans". This came after CM Sawant reportedly said that the government is in a position to employ only about 8,000-10,000 more people.

318.title: Digital lending platform FlexiLoans raises $90 million
318.article_body: Digital lending platform FlexiLoans has raised $90 million in a mix of equity and debt from Denmark-based Maj Invest and UK-based fintech investor Fasanara Capital. The investment will mark Fasanara's first transaction in India's technology space. The family office of Sanjay Nayar, Hong Kong-based Banga family and Alliance Tire Group Founder Yogesh Mahansaria also participated in the round.

319.title: Whenever we need them to score runs, they all get out: Kapil Dev on Rohit, Kohli, Rahul
319.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev criticised the approach of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul in shortest format of the game. "All of these are players who can hit at...strike rate of 150-160. Whenever we need them to score runs...they all get out," Kapil said. He added, "The approach needs to change. And if it doesn't...you've to change the players."

320.title: China will lose 40% of people every generation at current birth rates: Musk
320.article_body:
The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Monday tweeted about a possible "population collapse" while sharing an article about China’s birth rate. Musk wrote, "Most people still think China has a one-child policy. China had its lowest birthdate ever last year, despite having a three-child policy!
At current birth rates, China will lose approximately 40% of people every generation!"

321.title: Warne said I wasn't needed, later said 'you're my man': Ex-RR pacer Tanveer
321.article_body: Sharing his experience while representing RR in IPL 2008 with the team led by Shane Warne, Pakistani pacer Sohail Tanveer said he was initially informed that Warne "didn't" need him. "I bowled well and picked up 2/26 [in a match]. After that...Warne came to me and said '[you're] my man'," added Tanvir. Tanvir won the purple cap in IPL 2008.

322.title: Prince Harry & Meghan share photo of Lilibet on her first birthday
322.article_body: UK's Prince Harry and wife Meghan Markle on Monday shared a picture of their daughter Lilibet celebrating her first birthday at a backyard picnic over the weekend. Lilibet Diana Mountbatten-Windsor was born in California and was named in honour of Queen Elizabeth II, whose family nickname has been Lilibet since she was a toddler. Lilibet is the Queen's 11th great-grandchild.

323.title: Mother jailed after 2-year-old son shoots father dead in US
323.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was jailed and is facing criminal charges after her two-year-old son shot his father dead in the US. The gun was not properly stored and was easily accessible even to a two-year-old, said Orange County Sheriff John Mina. "A young child has to live his life knowing he shot his father," Mina added.

324.title: Maldives welcomes BJP's action against Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
324.article_body: The Maldives government has said it is "deeply concerned by the derogatory remarks made by some officials of BJP" on Prophet Muhammad. Maldives welcomed the "denouncement" by the Indian government of the remarks and the "prompt action taken by BJP against those officials".  BJP had suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over the remarks.

325.title: Candle flares bright before burning out: J&K LG on targeted killings
325.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said religious leaders and the people of Kashmir are condemning the targeted killings of civilians in the Valley. "When a candle is about to burn out, its flame flares bright. This (militancy) is taking its last gasps," Sinha added. "They are unable to digest the arrival of so many tourists to the Valley," he stated.

326.title: Will respond swiftly & forcefully if N Korea holds nuclear test: US
326.article_body: US Deputy State Secretary Wendy Sherman said any nuclear test by North Korea would be "in complete violation of UN Security Council resolutions [and] there would be a swift and forceful response to such a test".  "I believe that not only South Korea...US and Japan but the entire world will respond in a strong and clear manner," she added.

327.title: Top Indian woman cyclist accuses coach of 'inappropriate behaviour' in Slovenia
327.article_body: A top Indian woman cyclist has accused the national sprint team chief coach R K Sharma of "inappropriate behaviour" during a camp in Slovenia, according to officials. The complainant was "immediately" brought back to India "to ensure her safety", Sports Authority of India said in a statement. Two separate inquiry committees have been formed to look into the allegation.

328.title: Ram Charan, wife Upasana celebrate driver's b'day, pics surface
328.article_body: 'RRR' actor Ram Charan celebrated his driver Naresh's birthday on Sunday, pictures of which have surfaced on social media. In the pictures, Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni can be seen standing with Naresh, who was seen cutting the birthday cake. Charan is currently shooting for a film with director Shankar, which is tentatively titled 'RC15'.

329.title: Rajasthan BJP MLAs shifted to resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
329.article_body: The BJP shifted most of its MLAs in Rajasthan to a resort in the outskirts of Jaipur. This comes ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for four seats from the state, scheduled for June 10. Calling it a training camp, a party spokesperson said that the MLAs will be given training on the Rajya Sabha elections.

330.title: Muhammad Asif made me look like a very ordinary pacer: Shoaib Akhtar
330.article_body: Recalling the India-Pakistan 2006 Karachi Test, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "The way [Muhammad] Asif trapped the Indian team...I have never seen [such] a magician. He made me look like a very ordinary [pacer]." Akhtar added Asif dismissed VVS Laxman in the exact same manner in both innings. Akhtar stated he was trying to "hurt" Sachin Tendulkar in the Test.

331.title: Delhi govt to open 100 more mohalla clinics across the city
331.article_body: At least 100 more Aam Aadmi Mohalla Clinics will be opened across the city, the Delhi government on Monday said. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia met with officials to review the progress of the project. The government will soon completely digitise the clinics and doctors will be able to track the medical history of patients to provide better treatment, Sisodia added.

332.title: Making law for population control won't serve any purpose: Bihar CM
332.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said making a law for population control won't serve any purpose. "Population control can only be achieved by educating women and girls. The fertility rate can be checked only through education and awareness," Kumar added. He cited China's instance where one-child policy was in effect for many years. "It has now changed...to two-child policy," Kumar stated.

333.title: Indian-origin Gupta brothers arrested in UAE over corruption charges
333.article_body: The South African government on Monday said two Indian-origin businessmen have been arrested in the UAE while accusing them of profiting from their close links with former President Jacob Zuma and exerting unfair influence. The brothers, Atul and Rajesh Gupta, have denied any wrongdoing. Meanwhile, South African officials said that their extradition talks are taking place with the UAE.

334.title: Bear kills MP couple; drags them to nullah, feeds on body parts for 4 hrs
334.article_body: A couple was killed by a bear in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday morning when the two were returning from a temple near their house. The victims reportedly died while trying to save each other from the bear. Eyewitnesses reportedly told police that the bear dragged them to a nullah and fed on their body parts for four hours.

335.title: Admissions closing soon for IIM-I & Jigsaw’s Business Analytics Program
335.article_body: After 12 batches, IIM Indore's online Business Analytics Program will begin its 13th cohort soon. 83% of learners enrolled in this 10-month program have transitioned in their careers, Jigsaw revealed. The program offers 5D framework-based curriculum, BYOP feature and Kaggle's In-Class competitions & modules in technologies like Big Data, Data Visualization & ML to help learners grasp the concepts.

336.title: Was asked for extra ticket for 'Dil...' in theatre, said 'I'm director': Ananth
336.article_body: Actor Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who directed 'Dil Vil Pyar Vyar', said that he went to theatre to see reaction of the audience. "I had...the joy of someone coming and asking me, 'Do you have an extra ticket?' I told him, 'I don't need a ticket...I'm the director'. He got excited and said, 'Then you can get me tickets'," he added.

337.title: Ex-India cricketer Naman Ojha's father arrested in MP for cheating bank of ₹1.25 crore
337.article_body: VK Ojha, father of ex-India cricketer Naman Ojha, was arrested by police in MP's Betul district for allegedly cheating bank of ₹1.25 crore. Around 34 fake accounts were opened and KCC loan was transferred to accounts and a sum of ₹1.25 crore was withdrawn when VK Ojha was posted as manager of Bank of Maharashtra branch in 2013, police said.

338.title: India in talks to increase discounted Russian oil imports from Rosneft: Report
338.article_body: India is in talks to increase its Russian oil imports with state-owned Rosneft PJSC amid Western sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war, as per a report. It added that work is on to finalise a six-month supply contract for discounted Russian crude oil to India and that details on volumes and pricing are still being negotiated.

339.title: Fuel pump shut for selling petrol in bottles before Kanpur clashes
339.article_body: A fuel pump's licence was suspended after it was seen selling petrol in bottles, which is prohibited, in CCTV footage in Kanpur, said a district official. This comes amid violent clashes in the city over suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. A police officer said since petrol bombs were used, they tried to find the source.

340.title: Johnny Depp spends around $62,000 at Indian restaurant in UK to celebrate trial win
340.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp spent more than $62,000 for a special celebratory dinner with his friends at Indian restaurant 'Varanasi' in Birmingham  on Sunday to celebrate his defamation trial victory against his ex-wife Amber Heard. "The most talked about person on the planet right now joined us for dinner last night!" the restaurant wrote on Instagram, while sharing pictures.

341.title: Bomb threat issued to Lucknow, Unnao RSS offices; case registered
341.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police registered a case after a bomb threat to blow up Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) offices in Lucknow and Unnao was received on WhatsApp on Monday. An FIR was registered at Madiyaon Police Station in connection with the threat, police added. "With cyber cell's help, the number that sent the message will be traced," Lucknow Police said.

342.title: Dominican Republic Environment Min shot dead by friend in his office
342.article_body: The Dominican Republic's Environment Minister, Orlando Jorge Mera, was shot dead on Monday in his office by a close friend, the government said. Mera, son of former President Salvador Blanco, was shot by businessman Miguel Cruz, who was arrested at a church after telling a priest he committed a crime and handed over a gun to him, authorities said.

343.title: Sign naming road after Godse comes up in K'taka's Udupi; removed
343.article_body: Local officials and police have removed a signboard naming a road after Nathuram Godse, who had assassinated Mahatma Gandhi, in a village in Karnataka's Udupi following criticism. A panchayat officer said that no resolution had been passed for naming the road after Godse and a police complaint has been filed. Pictures and videos of the signboard had gone viral.

344.title: India reports 3,714 new COVID-19 cases, 2,513 recoveries in last 24 hours
344.article_body: India has reported 3,714 COVID-19 cases, 2,513 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,518 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 26,976, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,708, according to the latest data.

345.title: Viral video shows teacher sleeping in classroom as student blows fan in Bihar
345.article_body: A video showing a teacher sleeping in a classroom in Bihar's Bettiah has gone viral on social media. In the video, a student can be seen blowing a fan while the teacher is fast asleep. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "Bihar model of education," and "Welcome to Bihar."

346.title: I don't think I've made it in B'wood, have a lot to prove: Ahan Shetty
346.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty, who made his Bollywood debut in 2021 with the film 'Tadap', said, "I don't think I've made it in the industry...I have a lot to prove." Ahan won the IIFA 2022 award for Best Debut Actor (Male) for his performance in 'Tadap'. "It's...special for me. I want to continue to work hard...continue to prove myself," he stated.

347.title: Christianity being spread across Punjab to weaken Sikhs: Akal Takht Jathedar
347.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Monday said Christianity is being spread across villages of Punjab to weaken Sikhs. "Sikhs are facing a lot of difficulties that are making us weak religiously, socially and economically," he added. "I appeal to all Sikhs, especially those in border areas to spread and strengthen Sikhism," Singh stated.

348.title: Man trying to sell leopard skin worth ₹10 lakh arrested in Bengaluru
348.article_body: A 30-year-old man, who was planning to sell leopard skin worth ₹10 lakh, was arrested in Bengaluru on Monday. Acting on a tip-off, a police team posing as customers, approached the accused, identified as Dhanraj, and arrested him. The police also seized ganja worth ₹8,000 from him. According to police, Dhanraj has several criminal cases pending against him.

349.title: An error, statement made under provocation: Jethmalani on Nupur’s remarks
349.article_body: Reacting to former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jethmalani said it was an "insensitive statement made under provocation", which she has regretted. "The real fringe are those who on public platforms stoke fire created by her error and ruin GoI's efforts to repair the damage and restore India's image abroad," he tweeted.

350.title: Car parking lift collapses in 23-storey building near Mumbai, 4 injured
