350.article_body: Four people were injured after a car parking lift collapsed in a 23-storey building in Kalyan, near Mumbai. Reports said that the incident took place when repair work was being done and the lift was being tested. Police said that the building has a four-storey car parking facility and that the cause of the collapse will be checked.

351.title: BMTC to run 10 buses from newly-opened Visvesvaraya rail terminal
351.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has decided to operate 10 buses from the newly-opened Sir M Visvesvaraya terminal at the Byappanahalli railway station. The buses will make 144 trips a day, connecting the Visvesvaraya terminal to Channasandra, Central Silk Board, Banaswadi, Subbaiahnapalya, Nagawara and Munnekolalu Cross, said BMTC in a statement.

352.title: Staffer peeps at woman taking a bath at hospital in Pune; booked
352.article_body: Pune police have booked a 25-year-old staffer who works at a hospital in the city on charges of voyeurism and stalking after he allegedly peeped at a woman who was taking a bath there. The woman, who is a relative of a patient, approached hospital authorities and police but the suspect had fled by then, according to a police official.

353.title: 2 more minors raped in Hyderabad, number rises to 5 in a week
353.article_body: Two more rape cases involving minors were reported in Hyderabad on Monday, taking the total to five in a week. In the first case, a 17-year-old girl was lured and raped by a 23-year-old man, whereas in another case, the victim was sexually assaulted at a movie theatre. The accused in both the cases have been arrested, police said.

354.title: Auto driver molests 17-yr-old girl, bites her after she resists in Pune
354.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver allegedly molested a 17-year-old girl and bit her when she resisted in Pune, police said. She had taken the auto to go home but the driver took her to a secluded place, allegedly hugged her forcibly and also touched her inappropriately, police added. Two passers-by heard the girl screaming for help and rushed towards her, police stated.

355.title: Man in drunk state drowns during pool party in Gurugram; 4 booked
355.article_body: A 33-year-old man from Delhi allegedly drowned in a swimming pool in an inebriated state during a party in a village in Gurugram, police said on Monday. Three of the deceased's friends and the pool owner were booked for negligence causing death, ACP (DLF) Sanjeev Kumar said. The deceased's brother claimed that the man's friends had assaulted and killed him.

356.title: Bombay HC ends POCSO case as victim, now 18+, & accused decide to marry
356.article_body: Bombay High Court has quashed FIR under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act for penetrative sexual assault, after victim, who is now reportedly above 18 years of age, said she and the accused were in love and are now to be married. The bench noted if prosecution still remains, it will come in way of their peaceful life.

357.title: Ex-Punjab Minister and Cong leader Sadhu Singh Dharamsot held in corruption case
357.article_body: Punjab's former Forest Minister and Congress leader, Sadhu Singh Dharamsot, was arrested by Vigilance Bureau (VB) in a corruption case. A local journalist who was allegedly working as an aide was also arrested. This comes after VB arrested Mohali Divisional Forest Officer over graft charges. He disclosed to VB how Dharamsot used to be bribed before cutting a single tree.

358.title: Expected critics to rip 'Om...' apart, glowing reviews shocked me: Farah
358.article_body: Talking about her 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om' starring Shah Rukh Khan, director Farah Khan said, "I was prepared for the fact that the critics would rip it apart as it was crazier than 'Main Hoon Na'." "We showed Shah Rukh fighting with a stuffed tiger and what not!...I was...[shocked] that it got such glowing reviews," added Farah.

359.title: Steve Harvey confirms daughter Lori Harvey and Michael B Jordan's breakup
359.article_body: American TV host Steve Harvey confirmed his daughter Lori Harvey and actor Michael B Jordan's breakup. "I still gotta go to work...I still gotta take care of my family. I'm team Lori...1000%," he said. Steve added, "[Michael] is still a cool guy...from what I know. It's a breakup. I'm pretty sure they'll be fine. People break up all the time."

360.title: Bengaluru makes masks must in public places amid COVID-19 spike
360.article_body: Bengaluru's municipal body BBMP on Monday made wearing masks mandatory in public places. This comes amid a spike in COVID-19 cases. "Everyday, more than 200 new COVID-19 cases are being reported and we are conducting 16,000 tests," said BBMP official Dr Harish Kumar. The number of daily tests by BBMP will be increased to 20,000, he added.

361.title: Don't call us pro-China, we're pro-US: Taiwan's opposition party
361.article_body: Taiwan's main opposition party chief Eric Chu said it's wrong to label the Kuomintang (KMT) party as being pro-China as it has always been pro-US. However, he added that the party is also dedicated to defending the island by talking to Beijing. KMT party ruled China until fleeing to Taiwan in 1949 after losing a civil war to the Communists.

362.title: Saudi man offers to marry Amber Heard after she loses defamation case against Johnny Depp
362.article_body: A man from Saudi Arabia has offered to marry actress Amber Heard after she lost a defamation case against her ex-husband Johnny Depp. "Amber...since all doors are closing on you, you have no one except me to take care of you," the man said in a voice note circulating online. "I am better than that old man," he added.

363.title: I started diverting all my endorsements to charity work: Sonu Sood
363.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood revealed that he started diverting all the endorsements he did to charity work and education. "With steel brands, I started making houses, with light brands I started lighting villages...and when I did mobile brands, I started donating mobiles," he stated. "I'm educating thousands of kids in tie-up with universities, I did free endorsements for them," he added.

364.title: 17-yr-old boy found dead with stab injury in abdomen in Delhi
364.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was found dead with a stab injury in his abdomen on HR road near Ramjas School in Delhi's Anand Parbat area on Monday, police said. "We got a call at 7.15 am...regarding an unknown person lying dead on HR road," DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. "No eyewitness was found... [but] a case of murder has been registered," she added.

365.title: US rapper Trouble shot dead at female friend's apartment
365.article_body: US rapper Trouble, who collaborated with Drake and The Weeknd in his career, was shot dead at a female friend's apartment in Georgia. The police have issued an arrest warrant for 33-year-old Jamichael Jones. Police said Jones and Trouble were not known to each other, but that Jones was involved in a "domestic situation" with the woman Trouble was visiting.

366.title: ED files 1st charge sheet against Choksi's wife, calls her 'ultimate beneficiary'
366.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has filed its first charge sheet against fugitive Mehul Choksi's wife Priti Choksi in the ₹13,000 crore PNB fraud case, stating that she was "hand in glove with her husband" and was the "ultimate beneficial owner". Called "abettor of the crime", the fresh money laundering charges against Priti will allow agencies to pursue her extradition from Antigua.

367.title: UK PM Boris Johnson wins no-confidence vote
367.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has won the no-confidence motion brought in the country's Parliament over the 'partygate' scandal. Johnson got 211 lawmakers' support while 148 MPs of his Conservative Party voted against him. The vote was triggered after at least 54 MPs from Conservative Party submitted letters of no confidence to the Chair of the 1922 Committee of backbench lawmakers.

368.title: Apple introduces macOS Ventura with new tools & updates on Safari
368.article_body: Apple has previewed macOS Ventura desktop operating system with several new tools, like the Stage Manager, which lets users group windows and switch quickly between apps. Safari has added the Shared Tabs Group feature which will let users share a set of open tabs with their friends. Safari has also been enabled to use the more secure FIDO Alliance-supported passkeys.

369.title: Apple announces new MacBooks with M2 chip starting from $1,199
369.article_body: Apple has announced new MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with the M2 chip, which will include 25% more transistors and 50% more bandwidth than the M1. Apple said it's focused on power-efficient performance, maximising speed performance while limiting the amount of power needed to do so. MacBook Air with M2 starts at $1,199, while the MacBook Pro starts at $1,299.

370.title: Apple iOS16 adds 'Safety Check' feature to help people in abusive relationships
370.article_body: Apple's iOS16 unveiled on Monday will have a new feature called 'Safety Check' to help people in abusive relationships by revoking shared device access with their partners. It will stop location sharing, reset privacy settings and protect messages from the abusive partner. Apple unveiled updates to the 'My Home' app and a new protocol for smart home devices called 'Matter'.

371.title: Apple unveils iOS 16 with updated Lock Screen, adds 'Undo' feature for sent Messages
371.article_body: Apple on Monday unveiled iOS 16, which includes an updated Lock Screen that can be completely customised with widgets. The Lock Screen will also get a new 'Live screen' activity feature. The new iOS has also upgraded Messages app that will let users undo sent messages or edit messages after sending them.

372.title: Have a great year ahead: Tendulkar to Rahane on his 34th birthday
372.article_body: Taking to Twitter to wish India batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "Wishing you a very happy birthday Ajinkya. Have a great year ahead." Rahane, who made his debut for India in August 2011, has so far scored 8,268 runs across all international formats. Rahane last played in a Test against South Africa in January 2022.

373.title: Who is Radhika Merchant, Mukesh & Nita Ambani's son Anant's fiancee?
373.article_body: Mukesh and Nita Ambani on Sunday hosted an Arangetram event for Radhika Merchant, who is engaged to their son Anant Ambani. She is the daughter of billionaire Viren Merchant, the CEO of the pharma company Encore Healthcare. She studied politics and economics during her undergraduate from New York University and completed her Bharatanatyam training under Guru Bhavana Thakar.

374.title: This happens in our industry: Kuku on extra-marital affair with Aruna
374.article_body: Director-producer Sandeep Kohli, known as Kuku Kohli, has spoken about his extra-marital affair with veteran actress Aruna Irani, saying that such things happen in the industry. He added that the two live together. On being asked if his daughters have accepted the veteran actress as family, he said, "Aisa kabhi mauka hi nahi aaya (The opportunity never came up only)."

375.title: It's like he came to say goodbye: Gulzar on KK's last recorded song
375.article_body: After late singer KK's last recorded song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' was released, veteran lyricist Gulzar said, "It's like he came to say goodbye." Gulzar further said, "When he came to sing the song for 'Sherdil', it filled my heart with joy. It's a shame that this had to go down as one of his last songs."

376.title: Been tough 2 weeks but also exhilarating: Nadal on 14th French Open win
376.article_body: Reflecting on the past two weeks in Paris following his record-extending 14th French Open title, world number four Rafael Nadal said it has been "tough", but it's also been very "exhilarating". He added, "Very pleased, obviously. I'm happy...And I'll be leaving here with an unforgettable memory." Overall, it was Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title win on Sunday.

377.title: Russian authorities put investigative journalist on wanted list
377.article_body: Investigative journalist Andrei Soldatov on Monday said that Russian authorities had placed him on a wanted list and frozen his bank accounts. Soldatov is known for his coverage of Russian security agencies. Soldatov claimed the case against him had been filed in a manner similar to that of two journalists accused of spreading "fake information" about Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

378.title: I'm silent, not sick: Dharmendra in video refuting hospitalisation rumours
378.article_body: Actor Dharmendra shared a video denying rumours of him being hospitalised in a 'critical' condition as was reported earlier. "Main chup hu, lekin beemaar nahi (I'm silent but not sick)," said the 86-year-old veteran actor. "Be positive, think positive, life will be positive," said Dharmendra in the video. He was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

379.title: Man kills wife, daughters aged 2 & 3 with stone in Rajasthan
379.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife and two daughters, aged two and three years, by hitting them with a heavy stone after a domestic issue at a village in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. The man then ran away, police said. The couple's eight-year-old son was also present on the spot and he rushed to his grandparents' house to inform them.

380.title: I had to do Deepika's 'Bajirao Mastani' scene in audition: Manushi
380.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar has said that she was given a scene from actress Deepika Padukone's 2015 film 'Bajirao Mastani' for her audition. She called the audition "most intense and challenging", adding that the call after the audition confirming her role was validation that she could chase her dreams in Bollywood. Manushi made her Bollywood debut in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

381.title: NATO kicks off drills with Finland, Sweden amid tensions with Russia
381.article_body: NATO on Sunday kicked off a two-week military exercise with Finland and Sweden in the Baltic Sea amid tensions with Russia over the war in Ukraine. Notably, Finland and Sweden had applied to join NATO in May. Russia had warned the two countries against joining the Western military alliance and warned them of retaliatory measures against the move.

382.title: Happy to see how my nephew Nadal is totally normal guy despite success: Toni
382.article_body: Praising nephew Rafael Nadal, his uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he's happy to see how the 36-year-old is a "totally normal guy", who plays good tennis and hasn't changed despite having a successful career. Nadal recently won his 22nd Grand Slam title, an all-time men's record, at French Open. Toni is currently part of Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime's coaching team.

383.title: Delhi law student held for intentionally hitting biker with Scorpio car
383.article_body: A 25-year-old final-year law student from Delhi has been arrested after a video purportedly showed him speeding away after hitting a 22-year-old biker with his Scorpio car. The biker has claimed that the accused, who got into an argument with him, verbally abused and threatened him before intentionally hitting his bike. The law student's car has been seized.

384.title: Jailed leader Navjot Singh Sidhu hospitalised due to liver problems
384.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was lodged in Patiala central jail, has been hospitalised due to liver-related problems, Chandigarh's PGIMER said. The hospital said that he required further evaluation and his condition is stable. Sidhu was last month sentenced to one year in jail over a 1988 road rage case that led to a man's death.

385.title: Fire at container depot in Bangladesh continues for 3rd day
385.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has continued to burn for the third day on Monday. Officials warned that there is a risk of further blasts if the flames spread to chemicals stored nearby. An official said that a container with hydrogen peroxide was identified as the possible source of the fire.

386.title: Will finish my term, won't run for re-election: Sri Lankan Prez
386.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he will complete the remaining two years of his term but won't contest again, Bloomberg reported. "I can't go as a failed president...I have been given a mandate for five years," he said. His comments come as anti-government protesters have been demanding his ouster amid country's worst economic crisis since independence.

387.title: Teenage MP girl, uncle paraded with garlands of shoes for eloping; 8 held
387.article_body: A 17-year-old girl and her 48-year-old maternal uncle were allegedly abused and paraded with garlands of shoes around their necks in a village in Madhya Pradesh as punishment for eloping, police said. A case was registered and eight persons were arrested in this connection. The villagers allegedly abused the duo for the "immoral" act, police added, while quoting the FIR.

388.title: I started doing wicketkeeping as my father was a wicketkeeper too: Pant
388.article_body: Revealing how he became a wicketkeeper-batter, Rishabh Pant said, "As a kid, I started doing wicketkeeping because my father was a wicketkeeper too." The India wicketkeeper-batter added, "I have no idea if my wicketkeeping has got better or not, I am just trying to give my 100 percent every single day. I was always a wicketkeeper-batter."

389.title: Brazil begins talks with IAEA on nuclear fuel for planned submarine
389.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi on Monday said that Brazil has initiated discussions with the UN watchdog aimed at eventually allowing it to use nuclear fuel in a submarine. Brazil plans to acquire a nuclear-powered submarine under a contract with a French company. Notably, nuclear-powered submarines can remain underwater and at sea for longer than other submarines.

390.title: Nuclear-capable ballistic missile Agni-4 successfully tested from Odisha
390.article_body: India successfully carried out a training launch of nuclear-capable intermediate-range ballistic missile Agni-4 from Odisha's APJ Abdul Kalam Island on Monday, the Defence Ministry said. "The successful test reaffirms India's policy of having a credible minimum deterrence capability," it added. The test is part of routine user training launches carried out under Strategic Forces Command's aegis.

391.title: Want to inculcate Dhoni's calmness, self-belief: SA all-rounder Pretorius
391.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa five-match T20I series, South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius said he'll try to bring MS Dhoni's calmness and self-belief into his game. Pretorius made his IPL debut for Dhoni-led CSK this year. On the upcoming series, Pretorius said, "Performances in this series is going to go far to secure a spot in the [T20] World Cup."

392.title: Why is UK PM Johnson facing a no-confidence vote today?
392.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson faces a no-confidence vote in the Parliament on Monday over the 'partygate' scandal. A video of Johnson's senior aides joking about breaking lockdown rules to attend a Christmas party was leaked online in December 2021. Parties involving alcohol were allegedly held in Downing Street during the height of COVID-19 lockdowns in 2020 and 2021.

393.title: England Test captaincy had become very unhealthy relationship: Root
393.article_body: Speaking about England Test captaincy, Joe Root stated it had become a "very unhealthy relationship", adding it was taking a bad toll on his personal health. "I couldn't leave it at...ground any more; it was coming home," Root said. Root, who was replaced by Ben Stokes, led England in 64 Tests, winning 27 and losing 26 during his five-year tenure.

394.title: 20-year-old man arrested for 'needle attacks' in France
394.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested in southern France on Sunday after being accused of attacking people with needles. The accused was charged two days after 20 people reported needle injuries during the filming of a televised concert in Toulon. As many as 100 incidents of 'needle injuries' at French nightclubs and festivals have been reported since beginning of this year.

395.title: It's time to send an IAS officer to jail: High Court on officials not obeying orders
395.article_body: Karnataka High Court expressed displeasure over government officials not following court orders and observed, "It's time an IAS officer is sent to jail." It also observed that officers were not taking court orders seriously. The court said this after the state government failed to implement a July, 2021 court order regarding merging of Group-C with Group-B jobs in municipalities.

396.title: I was asked to have no expression for passport photo: Shabana Azmi
396.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar on Monday shared a picture of himself smiling on social media along with the caption, "Too smiley for a passport photo I was told." His step-mother veteran actress Shabana Azmi commented on the post, writing, "I was asked to have no expression for my passport photo and replied I'm an actress I can't be expressionless!!!"

397.title: Sri Lankan minister convicted of extortion, gets suspended sentence
397.article_body: Sri Lankan Cabinet minister Prasanna Ranatunga has been convicted of extorting money from a businessman over a land deal on Monday. Ranatunga, the younger brother of Sri Lankan cricketer Arjuna Ranatunga, was given two-year suspended prison sentence and fined 25 million Sri Lankan rupees. He was asked to pay one million Sri Lankan rupees as compensation to the businessman.

398.title: China's Beijing reopens restaurants amid declining COVID-19 cases
398.article_body: Beijing on Monday reopened restaurants for the first time in over a month amid declining COVID-19 cases in China's national capital. Museums, cinemas and gyms will be allowed to operate at up to 75% of capacity and delivery drivers will be able to bring packages to a customer's door. Authorities had conducted multiple rounds of mass testing during the outbreak.

399.title: Scorpio driver who hit biker & ran away in Delhi booked
399.article_body: The driver of the Mahindra Scorpio who rammed the car into a biker in South Delhi's Arjan Garh has been booked, police said.  A video of the car hitting the biker and speeding away went viral on social media on Sunday. The biker alleged that the driver verbally abused and threatened him before hitting the bike.

400.title: Anupam Kher meets UP CM Yogi Adityanath at his residence, shares pics
400.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his official residence in Lucknow and shared pictures from the meeting on social media on Monday. The actor wrote, "The stories of your early life were very entertaining and interesting as well as inspiring. You are a source of energy for us and for every generation of the country."
